The absolute worst thing about Holsteins is that it's inside the Cosmo.  Having to contend with their awful parking lot is not what I look forward to, as great a hotel as it is.  Otherwise, Holsteins is another addition to their great restaurant line up (Jaleos, Comme Ca, E, all very tasty).

We ended up taking our friend from Australia here since he was craving an american hotdog or burger and a shake.  Having been bummed with our last burGR place, we decided to try out Holsteins based on its yelp reviews.

Not disappointed!  I'm a sucker for a good vanilla shake...and Holstein's version definitely is near the top of the list.  Flavorful vanilla ice cream mixed in with delicious whole milk, doesn't get more basic than that - but oh so tasty.

Food wise, everything was in order, though my burger cooked rare made  entree time a bit underwhelming.  Started with ahi tuna poke, which came with a delicious bed of seaweed salad.  Tuna was cut into small chunks for easy transport with the salad into your mouth - very thoughtful of the chefs.  I had the gold standard burger which comes with aged goat cheddar and smoked bacon.  Bacon was a little on the jerky side, good flavor though.  I did find the goat cheese a bit overpowering on the palette, kind if drowns out the bacon and the meat.  I've had worse burgers.  Maybe the green chile burger next time...

We had all three sides - rings, regular fries, and sweet potatoe fries.  The  rings, man, delicious.  I don't like my rings falling apart so a little longer in the fryer is just fine for me.  The batter was crispy and thick enough to hold it all together.  Chipotle dip was excellent as well - creamy with a little bite at the end.  Perfect with both fries and rings.

Will be revisiting to try the sliders or maybe another burger.  But definitely for another milkshake and some rings.

Yum!! I loved the menu at this place. The cosmopolitan was interesting! We had menu items like pizza twinkies, chicken and waffles, and a burger with fried avocados and sweet potato onion straws. They also had blue moon seasonal available as well as a variety of other interesting microbrews. Very little wait to accomodate a group of 5 on a Friday night. My only complaint was for a casino\/restaurant in vegas, they had tiny bathrooms with only 1 toilet.  Lots of people are drunk and drinking in vegas and I wouldnt want to have to wait in line to go to the bathroom, although I am sure there are others close by. Oh and we were not allowed to take our drinks in that we ordered at the chandelier bar across the hall while we waited. We had to suck them down quickly in order to be seated.

This is a Great hamburger place! So many variation of burgers where you can also ass fried eggs to the burger. Onion rings are large and crispy a. While a burger can run $22.50, believe me it is worth it. I would definitely go back here when I  in Las Vegas. Not a place to miss out at. Holsteins is located in the Cosmopolitan Hotel.

Great vegan options and they offer gluten free buns. The vegan shake is also amazing. Thank god Vegas is finally catching on with healthy options.

Comfortable lounge seating is nice.

I came here on a Saturday morning. The service was excellent. I sat at the bar by myself, and the brunette-long-hair bartender seemed to know how tough it is for a girl to sit by herself. So she was extremely sweet and helpful to me. She was chilled, but you know that she is very serious about customer service. Yes, in addition, anybody who calls me sweetie is automatically considered to give good service in my book!
        However, the food and the drinks were not on par with the good service. I ordered two cocktails: upside down pineapple birthday cake and tropical splash. The drinks were beautiful but weak. I know that it was in the morning and kind of early to get buzzed, but I am in Vegas so what? 
         For food, I ordered the billionaire burger. I really LOVE...the name of this burger. Yes, paying $28.00 to supposedly eat like a billionaire. Why not? Another reason is that it kind of feeds my delusion of wealth. I love every single ingredient listed for the burger: Kobe beef, foie gras, truffle mayo, caramelized onion, but I do not love the burger together. It felt as it needs some kind of sauce to bring it together, just a suggestion. 
         Overall, I would come back here for the atmosphere and the service. But the drinks and the burger were absolutely not the best.
Very loud 80s music!   The turkey burger was good and the space pigs are awesome!  Our waitress was friendly and did her best to accomodate my special request as a non-red meat eater.

Looks to be just your standard restaurant, but inside are things that make you go Mmm. 

Hen House Burger is phenomenal. Simple concept of adding an egg to a burger, we've seen it before but Holstein's does it right. Expect to make a mess with this one.

The Steakhouse Burger with a peppered patty, steak sauce - and other perfectly combined ingredients - was mind-blowing too.  I couldn't make a decision to which burger was best. Each time I had one bite of one and then the other, I said "this one is best!".  They were both that good. And the fries were equally as good - some crispy, some soft - great flavor. The boyfriend and I agree this place is on our list of Top 5 burgers (probably Top 3 for me!).  

Captain Crunch Shake with vodka ... if you like Captain Crunch you'll love this! I wanted to try it based on the waitress's recommendation. No regrets, but I'll go with something that has chocolate in it next time - and there WILL be a next time.

Alcoholic beverages are stiff, service was quick (but also, I went pretty late), and the waitress was down to earth.

I just can't resist a huge buttery slab of foie gras set atop a delicious burger! 

1) quick service
2) billionaire burger! 
3) sweet potato fries or onion rings are extra with your burger. Otherwise, it comes with regular fries. I got the sweet potato and they were just okay. 
4) didn't get to try the shakes, but they looked good. 
5) my BF got the gold standard and he was not impressed... 

Overall, this is the second time I've had the billionaire burger and it's just as delicious as the first time I tried it. It's a definite must stop on my list!

If you are looking for a great place to get a burger in Vegas, you have to come here. The Gold Standard burger was amazing!

We arrived at 630 for dinner and were seated immediately. Our waitress was friendly and quick to our needs. We ordered drinks, appetizers, and our main entrée. Everything came out in a timely manner. This place is known for its adult milkshakes. If you want to try something that is unique, make sure you have one of these. On this visit, I did not try one but the people that I was with had them and they love them!

They had a great selection of beers and wine and some interesting cocktails as well. All in all, this is a great find.
We eat here at least once every Vegas trip, and have not been disappointed. The rising sun burger may be the best burger I've ever had. It is perfect. Also, fantastic onion rings!

Food is phenomenal hands down one of the best burger places. We go here every time  we come to Vegas 

However I don't know if we will ever go back. My wife got a big ass hair in her burger bun...which was just the start. Then our waiter Fabrizio (yeah that was his real name) decides to overcharge us on our credit card, and luckily one of us caught it. When we told the manager he simply said "sorry it happens" and revised the bill. All in all super unprofessional staff and shotty service outweigh the delicious burgers.

Really fun place with good food.  I went on a Sunday and the place was full of guys who were enjoying the football games.  It made it a really fun atmosphere.  Plenty of tvs to watch different games, and the restaurant area is far enough away from the bar that you are not disturbed by crowd.
The service was fabulous and food quite enjoyable.  We had a good variety and everything was tasty.  I'd definitely recommend this place and go back if i'm in the area.

The Cosmopolitan... simply breath taking... i love glitz and glamour and this hotel offers just that! 

My brother in law recently took my mother and I while were visiting for my sisters birthday weekend! 

Omg... yuuuum!

I started off by having one of their alcoholic Shakes....Pina Colada!!! omg!! to die for!!!!!!  Had  no trace of alcohol and went down just fine! 

Buffalo wings... amazing, steak frys... deelish! Sliders... so juicy!!!

Then we were one of the first to try their desserts! Very unique, tasty, and different... refreshing yet excited my taste buds... one of my favs was something I've never tasted... Ice cream with bacon! Sounds gross but oddly enough it was not! it was sooo good!

what a chub! 

will go back to try a huge burger!!! for sure!!!

Rising Sun burger with fried egg. Medium rare melt in your mouth Kobe beef, teriyaki glaze, nori furikake, tempura fried avocado, etc.... A combination made in burger heaven.  10 stars
Onion rings. Thick onions with crispy batter.  Oh yeaaa.  5 stars
Strawberry milkshake = expensive but so good.  I could drink at least 2 or 3 of these in one sitting if they weren't $10+ per shake!  5 stars
Bull-gogi burger. 4 stars.
Other burgers. 2-3 stars.
Duck fat fries, sweet potato fries and regular fries = mehhhhh.  Limp and sad.  2 stars

I love the Cosmopolitan and would already stay here because of the beautiful rooms but the fact that the Rising Sun burger is served downstairs gives me more of a reason to return to this hotel when I visit Vegas.  When it comes to "fancy" burgers, I normally prefer a good ol' backyard bbq style burger or InNOut over the Umami style fancy pants type burgers.  However the Rising Sun might just give that backyard style burger a run for its money.  Take away all the clubs, the glitz & glamour and unique entertainment on the Strip and I'd still return to Vegas just to eat this burger again.  Holstein's fries and other burgers are mediocre\/ok (with the exception of the Korean style one which was good too) so I would only come here for the shakes and Rising Sun.

I make it a point to eat here every time I'm in town.  Great place to stop by before clubbing at Marquee, which is right in front of Holstein's.  There's usually about a 15 minute wait for a table but you can also grab a table in the bar area which is first-come first serve.

Oh and another plus- Rising Sun doesn't have any onions in it so if you are planning on clubbing and working your game on some hottie in the club later in the night, you won't have to worry about having stinky onion breath. ;)

The food and shakes here are wonderful! 

I went with a girlfriend here one night and we split a Chocolate-covered Strawberry Shake and a Gold Standard Burger. 

The shake tasted just like a chocolate-covered strawberry! Totally hit the spot! It was a very comfortable portion for two people. 

We added sprouts to our burger, which was excellent, I recommend you add those if you're a fan of sprouts. The burger overall was great and the fries that came with it we're totally up-to-par on the fries scale.

The service was cool. Everyone was nice and attentive, BUT they were almost too attentive. I felt like I was being rushed out of the restaurant and it wasn't even a busy time - I was there on a Tuesday night around 9 pm. Otherwise, I had a great time at Holstein's and I will definitely come again.

My overall feeling for Holsteins in a sentence: Its alright, but not worth the price.

I ordered their Rising Sun burger, which  contained a kobe beef patty in teriyaki glaze topped with furikake, crispy yam, spicy mayo and tempura avocado. I thought the burger was overcooked, which ruined the texture of the kobe beef patty.  The spicy mayo was ok and not spicy so if you're not into spicy food you'll do fine with this burger.  I thought the tempura avocado was interesting.  The avocado was nice and soft with a nice crisp tempura coating.  It's a good burger but I don't think it was worth $16.50.  I probably would try a different burger if I dine here again.
Bartender was not very friendly, didn't smile and looked like he was not terribly interested in being there. Food was good. Expensive for a burger and beer but inline with other hotel restaurants.

We came here as we were staying at the Cosmopolitan.  This is a gourmet burger place.  I like their idea of selling shakes with alcohol. The wife had the surf & turf mini burgers and I had a burger with Kobe beef, potato chips and cheddar cheese (can't remember the name of the burger). We also had the Oreo shake with Baileys and kettle chips with blue cheese and French onion dipping sauce.  The surf & turf wasn't very good as it had this tiny piece of lobster with beef tenderloin.  The Kobe burger was good with a nice crunch from the potato chips but it feel short compared to other gourmet burgers I've had.  The Oreo shake was good but had very little alcohol.  A beer would've been better with the burger rather than the milk shake.  The potato chips were a good starter for our meal.  I'm glad we tried this place but not sure if we would come back.

Located on the second floor of The Cosmopolitan of Las Vegas. this burger place on steroids is not to be missed. Not only do they have some very creative burger creations but milkshakes with alcohol in them.  They will flatten you (both the burgers and the shakes). Try the duck fat fries, they are pure poison (I mean that in a good way). It is a bit noisy but who really cares, you not out for an elegant night of fine dinning. Stop by give it a try. Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!
Wonderful experience from the Cereal Bowl shake to the Nom Nom burger.  Good service and ambiance.

Love the burgers! Even better with sweet potatoe fries! The shoestring fries are my 2nd fav. 

I tried The Rising Sun, and it was so good. The kobe beef was cooked to order, however you like it. The meat came out perfect!

The Hen House was even better because it has eggs! I'm a big egg-lover. And of course bacon can do no wrong.

Holstein's is exactly what a "burger and brew" fan wants in a meal.  Their appetizers are a little pricey, but that's expected at a Hotel \/ Strip property, especially the Cosmopolitan.  My friend and I opted to go with the Fried Pickles to start knowing the burgers included a heaping portion of meat.  They were a pleasant surprise as they were the full spears instead of the normal "chip" format.  The herb-caper mayo really complimented the cornflake-like crust.  The drink menu and beers on tap will satisfy any libation request.  My friend ordered the Steakhouse Burger and I opted for the Gold Standard (protein style aka. lettuce wrap).  The Steakhouse Burger was crusted w\/ black pepper, creamy steak sauce, tomato confit, onions, mushrooms and swiss.  The Gold Standard had smoked bacon, aged goat cheddar, tomato confit, arugla and garlic aioli.  Overall, both were very tasty, however the kitchen misunderstood medium rare and sent my burger out well done.  I've eaten here over four times and each prior visit I haven't had any issues w\/ cooking temperature.  The server was very nice and stopped by a few times during the meal to check in on us as well.  If you're in town looking for a good drink and bite to eat, I would recommend stopping in.

Great place for  burgers and shakes. Needed a place to dine while at the Cosmo. All of the other places didnt open till like 4pm. This was a great fix. Cant wait to go back. Many more shakes and burgers to try.  The service was great.

I went here last night. Got there right around 12 so they had started their Late Night menu. Which has two of their shakes: Drunkin Monkey (alcoholic or non alcoholic) and Vanilla (non alcoholic). 

DRINKS: 
Drunkin monkey was AMAZING! An extra shot in it is $3. I didn't get it but my friend did and it was delicious. They too the shake off with a piece of banana dipped in chocolate and a good sized chunk of chocolate on top. Vanilla shake gets white chocolate on top. 

FOOD: 
Late Night menu is basically snacks but they also offer two of the burgers which are not listed. Regular cheese burger and a bacon cheeseburger. The cheeseburger was good. Meat was cooked well to my liking and it was pretty big. I couldn't finish it. Also tried their "Poutine" it's French fries topped with shredded beef, cheese, and gravy on the side! Very good but you have to dig around for the cheese. Still amazing though 

ATMOSPHERE: 
Since we got there at 12 the dining area was closed so it was just the bar which does offer first come seating. There's about 30 spots at the bar and around 7 tables behind it. They had a dj who was right behind us so it was a bit loud but it's Vegas so what do you expect. The service was great our server (can't remember her name but blonde tall and skinny) VERY sweet. She updated us on our food while we waited and was on top of refills. She's fantastic! 
Overall great experience. I have 4 stars instead of 5 because it didn't say on Yelp that they close restaurant and give different menu at 12.

This is a place the Wife & I agree on. I always get the Rising Sun med-rare, and he gets the Korean Bull-Gogi. I can't say how the other burgers fare since these are our go-to orders. Why change a good thing? 

The resto is located on the 2nd level shopping area at the Cosmopolitan. You can't miss the big blue and white cow statue. Service is ok - not bad, not fabulous. 

Parking: Valet or self-park at the Cosmopolitan.

BEST. MALT. EVER.  The burgers were just meh, and the cheese steak egg rolls need some retooling, but the fried pickles were on point. And, the malt, THE MALT, holy bajeezus!!! AAHHHMAAAYZING!!! I've been dreaming of it ever since we left Vegas, over a week ago!!! I'd go back just to get another one. Vanilla, please!!!

Service was Amazing.. burgers were very good! Yelp check in for the half off beer was lame ... they bring u a very small glass and say it's half off.. but this place is still getting 5 stars!! Super yummy! Try the thanksgiving burger .. our family LOVED IT
This place has amazing burgers. Perfectly done and mix of flavors is perfect. One of the best burgers ever.  Banana split shake was great as well.

We ate here on a Tuesday evening at about 9pm, it wasn't too busy and we were seated immediately.  We had the pork belly sliders and the Longhorn Burger with shoestring fries.  We also shared a Grasshopper milkshake.  

The sliders were the best part of the meal, great flavor and I could have eaten 5 of these :-) They were $9 for two.  

The Longhorn Burger had brisket, BBQ sauce, coleslaw and a pickcle on it.  We held the coleslaw and the pickle, but had to pay $2 (on top of the $16 for the burger) for a slice of cheddar.  The burger was slightly overcooked, the BBQ sauce was hardly there and I couldn't find any brisket on my half of the burger.

The Grasshopper shake was $11 and tasted of mint and chocolate, but there was no alcohol - I guess I expected to taste it at $11.

I would not go back to this restaurant - there are better places in Vegas and even back home in Albuquerque.

I have eaten here a few times and have always enjoyed the food.  However, I come here mostly for the Campfire Smores shake ( alcohol infused).  I really don't taste too much alcohol in any of their shakes, but they are quite delicious.  

The Rising Sun burger is very good as well as the Hen house.

All I have to say is hello shakes!!! Oreo shake overloaded with goodness?!! OK!

We visited during a bachelorette party on a sunday morning so we were all incredibly hungry. Burgers, fries, tots.... Everything was great!

Service was even just as amazing. Our server was attentive and friendly. It was a great way to start our Sunday fun day!

If you find yourself wandering on the 3rd floor trying to determine if you dressed appropriately swing back down to this joint. The price is decent and the food will surprise you (hopefully for the better). I had the brisket burger while visiting in Vegas and it made me forget about In and Out for at least a few hours. Honestly this place gets pretty creative with their burgers which I commend them for and the fries are awesome. I didn't get a shake because the beer selection was so good. I did get a pretty decent grumbly stomach after eating here but in all fairness I had been eating all sorts of junk including fried pickles and the Swedish fish candy from NY,NY hotel. I would visit again next time I'm in Vegas.

My husband and I went to Holsteins for lunch on a Monday, around 12pm. We didn't have to wait at all for a table. I had the best burger of my life (the Gold Standard) at this place...it may have set me back $17.50, but it was worth every penny (well, I suppose it didn't set me back quite that much since we had a Groupon, but I would gladly go back and pay full price for that burger). They brought out smoked cheddar popcorn when we arrived. Quite tasty. My husband got the wings, which were a generous sized portion and also very good. The fries were also crispy and delicious. 

Go. Get the Gold Standard Burger. Oh, and the birthday cake milkshake.
Stopped in for a milkshake.   You know it's good when one of them comes out with a donut speared by the straw... looking at the menu I'd come back for the burgers and cocktails too.

One of my favorite restaurants in Vegas. The casual vibe is great, the vast selection of tap beer is winning, and the burgers are a force not to be reckoned with! I've even ordered the Ali Tuna sliders and was super impressed. My bf got the Gold Standard and loved it!
Every time we come to Vegas, even if we're not staying at the Cosmo (which isn't often) we make sure to come here. 
The thing that's not so cool about this place is when sport games are on because they charge a $35 per person minimum to sit in the lounge chairs! Kinda crazy.
They have decent burgers. What I like best is their milkshake with alxohol! Delicious!! Must try nutella crunch!

Shake them buns! Shake them buns! 

Oh, I meant shakes and buns! Shakes and buns!

Holsteins is uber-pop art cute. There is a full bar so they serve alcohol filled shakes. I love a good minty creamy milkshake. So I ordered the Grasshopper. It was yumz, just like the Shamrock shake but with booze and chocolate malty bits. 

I also had the Fungi burger, which had a truffle marinated portebello. Burger was huge and juicy. Good stuff. 

Friends had a variety of other items, but the most raved about dish was the truffle lobster mac and cheese.

Fun place for shakes and buns! Shakes and buns!

Special thanks to Manager, Kyle Collins. He always goes out of his way to make sure everyone is warmly greeted and well taken care of.  We call him the "Day Maker," because he makes everyone's day! Please ask for servers, Militia or Brittany, they're exceptional! Holstein's food is excellent and their service is great thanks to Kyle and his staff!

Rising Sun and Golden Standard is definitely a must have! They use Kobe and Dry aged beef! Awesome beer selection and the ambiance absolutely fit the 'cosmopolitan' feel. If you want to skip the line to Marquee on Friday or Saturday, hang out here. Same Dj, less crowds, better drinks.. I mean where else can you have a burger and fist pump??

I'm honestly not even sure where to start with this one. 

The highest quality ingredients, matched together impeccably, and served in a gorgeous restaurant at a luxe spot on the Las Vegas strip with art by a fantastic local artist. Perfection!

I got the Gold Standard - to think of what I experienced with each bite brings tears to my eyes, it was beautiful! I also experienced the fried pickles (a MUST have), country fried bacon and the pork buns. Bring friends, split the appetizers and spring for the burger. You won't regret it. 

Finish things off with one of their amazing shakes - I had the Tira Misu, and I will absolutely be back for another. 

The staff are uber friendly and definitely knowledgeable. The prices aren't In N Out Burger, but they aren't Strip Steak, either. Right in the middle where they should be. The Gold Standard burger was $17.95 and worth double that. 

We'll be back, Holsteins. Oh yes, we will be back.

There was no table for the man and I,  so we decided to sit at the bar.  I don't like sitting at the bar cos it seems so busy and the bartenders don't really take good care of you.  But boy I was wrong! 

There are 2 bartenders that right away gave us a menu,  and asked for drinks.  They did not forget about us as at all!! Food did not take long to come to us.  Our mains came out before our appetizer and our sever apologied profusely! But we didn't care. Man ordered the million dollar, while I got the  fun gui burger. Both equally as good.  

I am so pleased that I came here! Good food, good service!

The shakes and appetizers are delicious! We didn't try the burgers because of previous reviews, but we would definitely return to Holsteins again and would recommend it to those who are looking for a casual meal.

It's a gastropub style burger joint with Vegas strip pricing and fancier burgers.

Heard a lot about their milkshakes, ordered a black and white.  Just like everyone says, it's a good milkshake.  So it's definitely worth coming here just for that.

Black truffle lobster mac 'n cheese: black truffle was too strong.  If the lobster didn't have a distinct color, you wouldn't have even noticed it was in there.  Sauce was underseasoned.  The chip garnish was interesting, but I don't see how that plays in with the dish.  Superfluous...but not a negative.

Korean kimchi hot dogs: was very intrigued by this menu item, but it was underwhelming.  It tasted exactly like a hot dog with bbq sauce.  Didn't get the sour punch from the kimchi, nor did I even notice pork belly in it.  The bun was very soft and delicious though.  

Gold standard burger: goat cheese cheddar was wonderful, and my burger was cooked to medium rare which is a plus.  Overall, burger was good, but lacked seasoning.  Bun was nicely done.  

Service was spot-on.  We sat in the lounge so we didn't have to wait for a table, so I can't say much for the actual dining service.  

For what it is, and being in Vegas, I'd say it's a good spot to go for a burger fix.  Is it a top tier burger place?  Remains to be seen when I come back again, because there's a lot of stiff competition out there.

I hate to compare any burger I've ever eaten in my life to my all time favorite Umami Burger, but given the price you pay at Holsteins I figured it'd at least come close to it. Unfortunately, my first experience here was quite disappointing. I yelped Holstein's Shakes and Buns & decided to give it a try after seeing it was given 4 stars. 

We came here on the Sunday of Halloween weekend & were glad that the wait wasn't that long. Our waitress kindly informed us about their "special" shakes (which i thought was unique to their establishment). I ordered the Gold Standard, which our waitress said they were most famous for. The burger LOOKED really good, but as I bit into the burger, I quickly realized that the patty was very bland. They had cooked it the way I wanted, but there was just no flavor whatsoever in the patty. My appetite disappeared soon after as I found it hard to even eat the french fries. Our waitress seemed to have disappeared for a while as well. 

Perhaps my taste buds were off that day from all the drinking the two nights before, but my meal just wasn't appetizing to me. Based on my first try here at Holsteins, I don't believe that they deserve the 4 stars. I am, however willing to give them another try & order something that would better appeal to my taste. I'm HOPING after that, I could also consider this fine establishment a 4 star restaurant.

Read the menu online and had heard a lot of good things about this spot, so I figured I check it out.  Plus anywhere that offers fried pickles on their menu gets a thumbs up from me.  I ordered the fried pickles, a chocolate shake and a Gold standard burger.  Fried pickles.....meh.  It had great texture, but I was looking for a slightly saltier finish.  The herb-caper mayo was really good though.  The chocolate shake, although a bit expensive, was good.  The Valrhona pearls were a nice textural touch.  And now to the gold standard burger.  I loved the texture of the bun and my burger was cooked perfectly.  The arugula was great balance to the sweetness of the tomato confit.  The flavor of the beef really stood out.  The shoe string fries were very good too with great crunch.  Very well executed burger.....expensive......but good

This was yet another happy accident find in Vegas. I love everything about this place, including the wall murals which include such images as a beef patty in a bikini (complete with better cleavage and lashes than most humans I've met) and a Spiderman\/pickle figure of some kind (you're gonna look for it now when you go, aren't you?). 

The milkshakes are unreal. They offer some off-the-menu milkshakes as well which you should surely ask your server about. The night we went they were offering a cake doughnut milkshake that sounded like as good of a poor decision as any in Vegas, nahdamean? We opted for the cookies and cream shake and were elated when it came out topped with a giant ice cream cookie. Best part - each shake comes overflowing with toppings and served with the leftovers that don't fit in the fancy glass on the side - great for sharing (the rest of the group at our table really appreciated it). 

As a self-proclaimed burger snob, I'll gladly give this place my seal of approval on all things beef patty related. The Golden Standard and the Fungi burgers are out of this world - give them a shot. I opted for regular fries but they have a sweet potato option that looked pretty good as well.

I love coming here and I love the food and atmosphere!  The staff has always been great EXCEPT the hostesses are the worst ever on the strip.  I have been here many times, and the worst time I had was when I went with my coworkers.  We all work at a day club and it was just girls.  I understand that Cosmopolitan has the worst problem anywhere on the strip with escorts, but I don't think us girls look remotely like escorts, but the Holstein hostesses sure treated us like we were unwelcome guests of theirs.  A couple girls came late to dinner and filtered in, and each time the hostesses at the front door INSISTED that there was no party of ours in the back of the place despite us texting our girlfriends that we were inside.  This happened three times that the hostesses would not even let the girls walk to the back to find us.  Seriously the hostess would not let the girl walk in to Holsteins to find our party.  I couldn't believe it.  Most places in Las Vegas LOVE having pretty girls around and usually will even pay to have pretty girls in places or pay for their dinners.  The hostesses here acted like we were hookers or something instead.  When we complained to our server each time this happened she didn't know what to do or how to handle the situation.  She never got a manager and being servers ourselves we didn't insist.  We liked our waitress so we didn't want to be too fussy.  Since this happened I haven't been back but I guess I am open to it if I want a burger.  The food here really is good during that once-a-week time of the month for a girl when I can just kill a whole burger, a salad, a milkshake and especially the fried pickles.

Delicious burgers and shakes!

the hype is real! I was a little weary this place might not live up to what people say but I was not disappointed. I went here with a group of friends and the wait wasn't terrible when we called ahead to reserve a table. We managed to get seated in about 20 minutes after calling. 

They have popcorn on the table! That was something new for me. I liked the their popcorn too, it was buttery but it had a slight acidic taste to it.. maybe vinegar? either way it was great to munch on as we were looking over the menu :) I decided to get the rising sun and the gold standard burger and an oreo milkshake to share with my boyfriend, The rising sun and the gold standard burger were the two most popular burgers to get but I could understand why! They were delicious but I really enjoyed the gold standard. It won the award for best burger in Las Vegas and I agree! After trying Gordon Ramsay's Burgr, I thought Holsteins was more enjoyable. Their burgers had more flavor and their ingredients really complimented each other. I thought their shake was good but it wasn't anything special. I think I prefer the shakes at Burgr.

Overall I thought the food was great! I would definitely come back again :)

Yeah it's Vegas but the price for a burger doesn't fit the service or vibe of this place. I got the rising sun burger which was good but it was close to $20. Really? Even gourmet burgers shouldn't be this much especially with the lackluster fries. 

Jordan, our waiter, was kind of a tool. He greeted us with a smile and then basically told my date and I that we looked like we went out partying last night. I thought we looked damn fresh in my humble opinion.  He subsequently asked us how we were and our unenthusiastic, one word answers responses seemed to offend him. He was rude and very slow in retrieving my credit card after the bill. (He was too busy getting chummy with other tables that were in the mood for small talk). Left wishing I tried the place next door instead.

Shakes and Buns?! I'm sold!

I knew I wanted to try a 'crazy' shake when I saw the online menu before we go to this place, but they didn't seem to have as many shakes as I saw online or my failed memory from constant drinking and partying the many nights before was kicking in or I was just starting to feel 26. Who knows?

We opted to sit in the lounge area (only 2 of us since the rest of our party decided to fly out of Vegas early, good if you don't want to gamble all your winnings away last minute) and we were greeted by our waitress.

I ordered from the Tiny Buns (also known as sliders) and got the Crispy Pork Sliders! I was also suffering from what we believed to be a food allergy to something from the night before, so we informed our waitress that I have a seafood allergy and she went ahead and informed the kitchen of this so they would take extra care as to not contaminate ANYTHING with seafood. Man do I miss seafood... +50 stars for this alone.

The pork sliders were small, but filling...may be small for other people though! They pan fried them for me to be extra safe.

My dining partner, Jeff L., ordered some fat ass burger called The Rising Sun. I didn't get to taste it, but it looked REALLY good. Also, it comes with fries, but not enough fries where it you could split it amongst people.

I didn't want to overeat, even though we were in Sin City, so I just got a shake as oppose to the pretty awesome sounding appetizers. We shared the Cereal Bowl shake which basically had Captain Crunch in it. It won't cut the roof of your mouth!

Downside: we didn't get any utensils or condiments and\/or free popcorn and couldn't flag down our waitress for it either! Whomp whomp had to ask the bartender!
The patty didn't even taste good. Ended up getting food poisoning. Will definitely not be going back.

Well this one is a hard review for me. I truly feel like Holsteins is a mixed restaurant and depending on what you are looking for will either leave you satisfied or wanting more. What does this even mean? Well as a burger restaurant it falls flat on its face. To meat tasted dry and bland. Lots of bread, and for the cost really leaves you craving more. 

As a dessert joint with their hard shakes, it's a real winner. The milk shakes are large and offer unique toppings. Even though they are 15.00 you feel like it's worth it. Would I ever go back? Only for a quick unique dessert. Never will I eat dinner here though.

As a vegan, I feel dirty and weird eating at a place called Holstein's. Why do so many themed restaurants (like burger places) think its clever to decorate their restaurant with the same animal they're also selling? That shit creeps me out.

Anyway, they have a few vegan options here and my sister and I were in desperate need of food. Their "Urth-burger" was actually really good and had all of my favorite toppings - avocado, avocado, avocado.

Oh and they have an alcoholic veganized milk-shake on the menu. It is damn delicious. 

They also have a DJ playing pretty good tunes as you eat. I danced to Daft Punk while I stuffed my face.

I came her for a quick lunch before heading to Marquee dayclub and boy oh boy am I glad I did !

Food: My friend and I decided to share everything we ordered which consisted of the ahi tuna tostada, the billionaire burger, and the banana cream pie shake. The ahi tuna tostadas were a great app to start the meal with! The fish was fresh and the lemony avocado sauce was very refreshing and a great compliment to the dish. However, I was amazed at how delicious the burger was! The burger had foie gras in it which is a food item banned in LA. I decided to jump on the chance to try it and I absolutely loved it. As for the banana cream pie shake, I usually don't like shakes but this one was a guilty pleasure ! However, I must say it would be too much for one so  I recommend to share with another person and sorry to be a bearer of bad news but  kids you can't have any because it is spiked with alcohol!

Service: Our server was always attentive and came back a couple of times to refill our water so no complaints!  But shame on him for offering us the shake and dessert menu! I probably gained 1377384893 pounds, but that shake was oh so worth it!

Final Verdict: One of the best burger places I have EVER tried!

Love this place. 

This is our go to place for a quick bite EVERYTIME we are in Vegas and staying\/visiting THE COSMO. 

Over time, we have tried the following and have fallen in love. 

Thai Steak Salad
Fried pickles (don't ask, just try)
Kobe beef sliders
Truffle lobster mac-n-cheese
Ahi Poke tostada

Try these. You won't be sorry.

This place was so yummy! To start, they brought out complimentary pizza-seasoned popcorn! We had to ask for a couple of refills since it was so good. Our group also ordered the Fat Boy Adult Milkshake to share and it was definitely the BEST milkshake I've ever tasted. We got it with coconut based ice cream, and it still tasted amazing! 

I ordered the Green Pastures Salad with Ahi and it was delicious! The only thing I would change about it would be the dressing, although they don't give you options for dressings. It would have been a lot more enjoyable with another kind. I tried some of my friend's burger and it was definitely a 10\/10 in taste! I think it was the Rising Sun Burger. 

Our waitress also gave us complimentary liquid-nitrogen meringues for dessert. Those things are so cool! I've never had anything like it. I would definitely eat here again.

My milkshake brings all the boys to the yard and they're like, it's better than yours.." DAMN RIGHT it's...... THOSE ALCOHOLIC MILKSHAKES though!!! Soooo good!

Anyways back to my review, TBH originally my fiance and I wanted to go to Gordon Ramsay's BurGR at Planet Hollywood for dinner (sorry haha), but it was a 45 min wait and we were HANGRY lol. 
So we went here to Holsteins at the Cosmopolitan as our next option. 

And good thing we came here!

We went inside and got seated right away. Plenty of seats and tables. 

We ordered their Bam-BOOZLED milkshakes, which has alcohol in them. I ordered the cookies n cream shake and WOWWWWW IT WAS DELICIOUS!!!!! I can hardly taste the alcohol and I had a good buzz out of it (maybe because I drank it too fast? lol sooo good!!) 
FORGET GOING TO SERENDIPITY 3 for the frozen hot chocolate when you can have Holstein's milkshakes with ALCOHOL in it!!! 

We also ordered the rising sun burger & steakhouse burger. The burgers are a little pricey but totally worth it. The quality is there! Probably one of my favorite crafted-burgers. Patty cooked to perfection. I recommend the rising sun burger for sure!

5 stars hands down. Please excuse the excessive use of my capitalization words lol. Holsteins is BOMB.

I came here to eat with a group of friends, the service was okay although my hamburger wasn't that great to me and tasted not so great. I only ate the French fries. The waitress said there fryer was broken and suggested if we wanted salads instead. I mean Hamburger with no French Fries Weird. when our food came out our French fries were on the plate. She then said the fryer the fixed so odd it was fixed. I had to literally ask her for a coke refill.Instead of her asking.You would think I worked there. Sorry but they need to be more polite and attentive to the customers. I then told her I took a bite and wasn't satisfied to take it off the bill. She took 50% of the plate I ordered . I will not return here again. I would rather go else where.

Their vegan Urth burger is really good. Their kale salad is fantastic. And they even have a vegan milkshake! The only thing I have to complain about is that they put whipped cream on the vegan milkshake. Whoops. But everything was wonderful otherwise!

The Nom Nom Burger was too fancy and didn't meet expectations. Comes with a beef patty, potato chips, cheese, and Thousand Island dressing. According to Urban Dictionary, "Nom Nom" means to eat with extreme delight. I'd give the burger one "Nom" -- I had delight, however it was mostly because of the fries.The shakes options look very good, but I wasn't in the shake mood.

Note: The Thousand Island dressing does have ground up pickles in it, but they're not overpowering, and the dressing is pretty good.

This place was legit. Me and the fam came through after some drinks on the strip wanting some grease in our bellies. 

We placed to-go orders (which you place at the bar) and the bartender who assisted us was nice and helpful. 

I ended up getting the Classic with no mayo and some regular french fries. The burger was good. It was a bit dry and the amount of ketchup was a bit stingy. Lettuce and onions were plentiful and tasted fresh. Fries were good and they threw in enough ketchup packets to keep me happy. 

I also ordered the Chunky Monkey adult milkshake. The Chunky Monkey is the main reason why I'd return. Awesome milkshake and I'm really considering going back today to pick up another one. Bananas, chocolate, and Reese's peanut butter cups. YASSSS. 

Other than the dry burger, it was a bit pricey, but hey, it's Vegas. Go big or go home, right?

Tolle Zusammenstellung von Burgern, schöne Karte, nette Location. Service war ganz ok, aber es war auch mittags und viel los. Mein Fleisch war fast Well-Done und nicht Medium rare wie bestellt. Dennoch sehr schmackhaft. Trotzdem würde ich für einen Burger wahrscheinlich woanders hin gehen. Ich weiß zwar nicht wo, da ich sonst keinen Burger in Vegas hatte, aber es gibt bestimmt Alternativen...

Highlights of milkshakes:
#Cereal bowl: vodka, fruit loops, cap'N crunch!
#Birthday cake: vodka, birthday cake crumbles, sprinkles
#Coffee & donuts: coffee ice cream, cake donut, malt, kahlua, chocolate espresso beans

Each order come in 2 cups: the milkshake cup (fancy glass) and then the flowover milkshake cup (metal bowl), so by buying 1, actually you will get 2 separate cups, meaning: BUY ONE, GET 1 FREE. 
Huge portion in each cup. Very delish,  just right sweetness for my taste.

Billionaire burger $32: kobe beef, foei gras, port onion marmalede, trifee, trufle mayo. The most expensive burger ever, but interesting to try. 

Service: 4\/5
Guests: mixed, but mostly white
Cleanness: 5\/5
Area: strategic, crowded, in hip place (in front of marquee club- cosmopolitan hotel)

Known for shakes and burgers, I would see why!  I went here to eat dinner before a concert and we ordered the Rising Sun burger. It was really good! They cook the beef however you like it. I would recommend ordering the Rising Sun for newbies. I ordered the smores milkshake and it was a d*mn good shake! 

I really wanted to give this place 5 stars because the food was really good and so was the service but it took an hour for my shake to come out. I came in at 7 pm and had a concert to attend at 8 pm. I did not get my shake til ten after. I took the shake to-go and had to scarf it down in less than 15 minutes which did not make it enjoyable. 

I would definitely come back again because the food was just so good. Hopefully they have more than one guy making the shakes.

I thought this place would be over hyped but I was pleasantly surprised! 

The restaurant is located on the second floor of Cosmo, right across from Marquee entrance. It is pretty spacious inside with plenty of tables. We were seated immediately and the service was quick yet friendly. 

They provide complimentary popcorn which was nice to munch on while we waited for our food to arrive. I shared a Rising Sun burger and a Tiramisu milkshake. Both were incredibly delicious!!! The burger came out just the way we wanted, but the restaurant doesn't cut the burger in half for you. It's a little inconvenient but I guess it makes sense since it would ruin the presentation of some burgers. We ordered the burger with a side of steak cut fries, which were basically potato wedges and not steak fries. Just a heads up for those steak fries lovers out there! The milkshake also tasted a lot like a tiramisu cake!! I would recommend splitting a shake since they are HUGE. 

The menu items are a little pricey but it didn't seem to bad when I split a burger and a shake. The shake is really heavy so unless I plan on skipping a burger (which I would never do) I would definitely split it.

Had high hopes for Holsteins. It didn't totally disappoint, but did run into some issues. 
Had reservations for 7:30 as we had a concert to attend at 9 over at MGM. Figured it wouldn't take more than an hour to enjoy a meal. Came to the desk about 5 min. prior. Took them over 10 minutes to get us seated. 

The server was friendly and helpful. Ordered the Oreo shake - a MUST try. So, so good I nearly drank the whole thing before my meal came. 
For my meal I ordered the Hen House burger add cheese....cooked medium. My brother ordered the Carbonara Chicken sandwhich. 
It was busy so it took about 15 min for our orders to come out after drinks were served. No biggie, to be expected. First thing I noticed was that they forgot the cheese on my burger. Again, no huge deal. Took a while for the waiter to come back around but got me some cheese on a plate. 
Next, I cut into the burger. As I ordered it to be cooked medium I expected cooked with a little bit of pink. Unfortunately, it was cooked near rare. I ate two bites luckily from the outside (more cooked) part of the burger before noticing. By this time it was getting close to having to leave for the concert. Server was great and offered to have it re-cooked. As we needed to leave quickly he offered to have it placed in a to-go box but sadly we could not bring food into the concert. 

This resulted in the burger being taken off the bill and the friendly manager offering us some cool nitrogen? type desert bites. Very much appreciated even though I sadly did not get to enjoy my meal. The chicken sandwhich was awesome (Def had to steal a bite from my brother). The shoe string fries were so-so. 

Had purchased a groupon ($20 for use of $40) which the bill ended up being less than $30. Sad.
Fantastic hamburger !!!! I have no words to describe the joy Inl had having dinner in this establishment. It's priced we for Vegas which is always a surprise.

Sam was the very best!!! She is adorable and recommended the best! I had the Risingsun burger and I was out of this world!!! My boyfriend had the Gold standard , it was yummy too! Fries are Chrissy and perfect. Our shake was the best shake I ever had in my life! It was the Banana foster , I'll be so sad when I go home and crave this place! Thanx Sam!!

This place is the definition of gourmet burger! I had the rising sun, with a friend egg on top?! genius!!! very big and juicy burger, you really cant go wrong. The get real creative with their burgers and its sooo huge that I just gotta keep coming back to try more!

On the first night of my bachelorette party, my friends and I came back to Holstein's for a dinner of burgers and booze.  I repeated some favorites from my first visit - the spicy bloody mary, the fried pickles, The Rising Sun, and the Frozen Grasshopper - and all were as remembered.  In fact I'm mostly updating this just to document my bachelorette party in full, so if you want to see a full useful review, please see the original and ignore this post, which is basically for my diary use only.

We came at around seven o'clock and were told they were so backed up they were turning people away.  We put our name and number down anyway, expecting to wait at least an hour and a half.  I guess a lot of people were discouraged enough to bail, because we were seated after something like forty minutes.

Service was good, polite and moderately quick.  A few of my friends and I use FourSquare (sorry, Yelp), and we each got a complimentary Holstein's Spacial (not a typo on my end) Lager.  It was tasty, refreshing, and free, and I'm sorry to admit that we were too full to finish them and felt pretty bratty.  We did leave a nice tip.

I did try a couple new things this time around, and I'll just note those here.  The Fun-Ghi (hey, you know that joke, don't you?) was a great burger with a beef patty, roasted portobello, caramelized onion, truffle oil, gruyere, frisee, and aioli.  The mushroom was great, and went really well with the beef.  All the other accompaniments took a back seat, letting the two top players have their day.  For dessert, we supplemented our Frozen Grasshopper with a Campfire Smores shake - Smirnoff marshmallow vodka, chocolate, marshmallow, and a graham cracker crumble.  I mean please I will never stock Smirnoff marshmallow vodka in my home bar, but it worked here.  The shake tasted like s'mores, and it was delicious.

My girls got my dinner, for which I am very grateful.  Holstein's was fun and full of tasty things, a great start to an epic bachelorette weekend.

I did it again!   I showed up to a place Hangry and started scarfing down food before taking a picture.  :)

The Steakhouse Burger is a dang good burger.  The cut of meat is exceptional and the peppercorns really add a nice pop to the flavor.  If you like high quality burgers where the meat is the prominent element, this is the burger for you.  

Maybe I should go with a 5star because the cut of meat really was that good, but I just had BurGR's UK Burger last night (formerly known as the Britannia Burger) and its dominance as the best burger I have ever had might be setting the bar too high and making me too critical.

The pizza flavored popcorn and the fries are top notch sidekicks to go with the burger.  I considered a shake, but nothing inspired me on the menu (could have been lack of pictures or descriptions, I dunno)...Maybe another time.

I would definitely recommend swinging by Holstein's to sink your teeth into things.   You won't be disappointed.
Burgers are great but the cookies and cream milkshake is amazing!  Oh and it's worth the extra shot.  I'll come back to Vegas just to get my Holstein's fix!

man, this place is good.  i got the captain hook which was a nice piece of seared salmon, plus a piece of gravlax on a bun.  the aioli served w\/ it was delicious.  i opted for a side of salad rather than fries, so it was a pretty healthy meal.  i tried the sweet potato and steak fries, and they were really good.  

milkshakes here are sooo yummy also, particularly the grasshopper and the oreo ones!

The unexpected touches are what elevated this from a 3 to a 4 star experience for me. I'd read the reviews, so I already planned on getting a boozy milkshake, skipping the sliders, and ordering the Rising Sun (Kobe beef, teriyaki, nori furikake, crispy yam, spicy mayo, tempura avocado) - all of which were fantastic recommendations. (Thanks Yelp!)

But I wasn't expecting the complimentary popcorn (that our group quickly renamed crack-corn), nor was I expecting the complimentary nitro meringues to finish off the meal. It was clear that the servers, even on a busy Saturday night, were eager to make our experience memorable. And from start to finish, that's exactly what it was.
Big juicy burgers that aren't too expensive. Fries were good. Milkshakes looked delicious.

A decent wait for some great food. My boyfriend I both got burgers that were completely cooked to our liking and delicious. I saw a deal for a $4 cocktail on yelp and asked the server and then he asked a manager about the deal. The manager informed the server that this deal was no longer available but because it was advertised as such he still let me order a cocktail for $4. I really appreciated the effort and politeness from my server and thoroughly enjoyed my visit.
The al pastor burger and the funghi burger were yummy.  Cooked perfectly to a tender medium and served with a pail of fries.  Bridget at the bar was awesome.

Came to have lunch, while waiting I went to the bar to order a beer. Was there about 5 minutes just long enough to be helped and brought my beer, only to have a server sent over by the manager who asked "are you going to stand here long?". I looked at her puzzled saying I was just ordering a beer while we waited, and she replied (pointing at the table behind me) that they had paid $200 to sit there and I was blocking their view.

I was shocked and explained I was just ordering a beer from the bar, (you know, like people do at a bar) before she went on about that table being upset and they needed me to move.

I was flabbergasted. I told her that this was incredibly rude, that I had only been standing there long enough to order the beer, but since my business was apparently unwanted, that I would not be eating there at all now. I looked over at the table in question, which was had incredibly snobby looking patrons sitting, who would not even look at me.

I went to the front of house, talked to the manager. I found he was the one who sent that server over to ask me to move! He did say he sent her over to talk to me, but apologized about the way it was handled. He seemed sincere, but I dont know how you can ask staff to do something like that.

Terrible service, never got to taste the food. Wont be back.

The service and shake was amazing! Loved the cute atmosphere and the lounge by the bar. I got the Fat Boy shake and it was exactly how I thought it would taste. It's a hard ice cream milkshake with lots of sweets as a garnish. Loved it. Vegas needs bigger and fun drinks like this!

SO GOOD! You will not be disappointed. I went with a group of 5 on a Saturday and they easily accommodated us right away. Each of us got a different burger and they all received raving reviews.

The Rising Sun burger was unreal. Super juicy (medium), with great teriyaki flavor and crispy yams on top. The tempura avocado adds a neat kick to the burger as well. I loved the bun too. The burger didn't fall apart but was a very good size. Every bite was delicious. 

The fried pickle appetizer was awesome as well. Just wrap those suckers in the meat, give them a dip and you are ready to go. 

I can't wait to go back when I am in Vegas!

A hip eatery in a very chic and sophisticated hotel. The decor was modern and well done. The service was good. The "Classic" burger was "ok", not bad but not great and I found the bun slightly on the tough side. The Holsteins Chopped salad was quite good as was the fries although the portion was quite small. I enjoyed the home made ketchup.

Exc - None
Good - Decor
Ave - Food
Poor - None

WOULD I GO BACK? No, there would be no reason to do that.

I had no expectations walking into this place. All I know if this looked like an expensive burger joint so I'm ready to swamp an above average burger down my throat and wash it down with a shake. 

Food: 
We had a group of 15-16 people. We all literally ordered the same thing. The burger just didn't taste good...and it was overcooked. No I didn't ask for them to change my order and medium rare my piece of meat because I don't think that would have mattered. 

Only exception to the food\/drinks was the chips and dip they served. 

Service: 
Service was decent though the waitress appeared flustered to take our orders. You're in Vegas woman get use to it! J\/k I'm really not a jerk, but seriously you're in Cosmopolitan and across from one of the hottest clubs in town. Work FASTER. 

Environment: 
Felt like an expensive burger joint in here. Need I say more? 

Price: 
Didn't pay...but I'm sure it was overpriced. 

Food: 2
Service: 3
Environment: 4
Price: N\/a but it I had to guess I'd give it a 3

It's pretty overpriced but it's Vegas. The burgers were fine but nothing to write home about. I got the Nom-Nom Kobe burger, which had potato chips on it and no produce so it was quite salty, especially with fries on the side. I wouldn't order it again. My husband's burger was much better. He got the gold standard and it was very good. The onion rings were also very good. They have some good looking shakes on the menu but we didn't try them. Service was pretty meh overall. Also, I don't really get the whole cartoon theme and think the cow things is kind of stupid for a grown-up burger joint in Vegas.

Went back a second time for dinner. The place was very busy. I booked for 8pm, arrived 7:45pm, only seated at 8:30pm and food arrived 9:10pm. 

Waiter wasn't paying attention. Got same order as first visit. Had to send meal back three times. In the end the food was good, but the service sucked. This will likely be my last visit.

Updating once again based on experiencing the BILLIONAIRE BURGER.

My friend and I ended up eating here because we came to Cosmopolitan to eat at Comme Ca, unfortunately SEMA was in town and Comme Ca was hosting an event in their dining room. Being that we did not want to sit and eat at the overly crowded bar at Comme Ca, we walked over to Holsteins. We had to wait for a seat here too so I was really freakin hungry when we sat down. 

One bummer about this experience was they did not bring out any complimentary popcorn. *womp womp*

Other than that our server was very nice and helpful. He knew the menu well. BUT. My friend and I knew we were getting the Billionaire Burger because we HAD to have a burger with foie gras in it. Yep. This burger comes with a big chunk of grilled foie gras right in the burger. It has Kobe beef with frisee, port-onion marmalade and truffle mayonnaise. DANG. If you don't feel like hitting the high-roller tables after this burger something is wrong with you. I also added some cheese to mine. 

We also split the "Snickers, Please!" dessert, which was decent, but I would suggest going with one of their bomboozled milkshakes and have it WITH your burger instead.

Holstein's does it RIGHT in the world of fancy burgers in Vegas.

Overall, good burger and fries. 
It is a little on the pricey side, but that's what is expected in Vegas. 

Service was quick and people I was with had shakes as well. They were huge and impressive.
Loved this place! I had the salmon burger-- the burger was super delicious! Highly recommend this place -- not too expensive either roughly 25$ -$30 per person

Oh my goodness.  This place was amazing.  The poutine appetizer was amazing.  The shakes were phenomenal - worth the money and the hype.  The burger (husband) was terrific and whatever salad I had was also really tasty.  I will make every effort to visit this place again and again.
The burgers are great. They can be large so come hungry. Thr shakes are good, and can be strong on the alcohol side.

Good thing for them, I really loved the food otherwise they would be getting a lower amount of stars. So let's start with the food! Like I was getting at, AMAZING. I got the Black and White malt (non alcoholic) and it was delicious. Perfect amount of malt. That was dessert for us but it seemed that everyone was ordering them for before their meals which I thought was strange. Anyways, yes wonderful mix of vanilla and chocolate. Next, my friend got the "Urth" burger. It's a vegan burger with all the fixins. She said it was delicious but tasted a bit like a spicy cup of chicken ramen noodles. But she does enjoy Ramen noodles so I suppose she liked it. I opted for a good old red meat burger, more specifically The Gold Standard. DRY AGED BEEF SIRLOIN BURGER W\/SMOKED BACON, AGED GOAT CHEDDAR CHEESE, TOMATO CONFIT, BABY ARUGULA & GARLIC-CHIVE AIOLI (courtesy of their actual menu). Yummmmmm!!!!!!!!! So so good. Now to the stuff I could have dealt without. Hostesses were irritated and seemed very "valley girl". I jsut want some lunch I don't need any attitude. And our waiter was such a dbag. I think it was because I didn't want his reccomendations. Uh what else was I supposed to do while I waited 20 minutes for my table...look at the menu...

Come here. Don't base this place off the staff. Base it off the food and you won't regret it.

Tried this place for the first time 3 months ago before going to the Marquee Day Club. The food here is pretty good and I shared the caesar salad and Surf N Turf Quesadilla with my friend :) I would definitely come again !

Great and varied menu selection, everything highly customizable, efficient service (though my server guy was being a bit too interested, maybe because he didn't have enough other tables).

Minus 1 star bc the booth height is oddly 3-6" too low for the dining table (and I'm average height), which made for an awkward ergonomic experience; and the bleu cheese dressing was runny, so didn't scream high quality.  Otherwise, the food was tasty and fresh.  I'd go back.

Good selection of burgers, a little greasy, but you knew that right?
Onion rings were crisp and the salad was fresh and just right size.
Gold standard, onion rings and a side salad came to  $34.00 with tip. 
I only had water.
Good service on way to LAS airport.

Went here solo.  Bartender...super nice.  Started with ahi tostadas,  don't recommend... was unexciting, taken out of the fridge and theown on an iffy tostada ring...  Burger was pretty damn good,  but ive had better.  Fries were decent.

I don't order burgers usually when going out but decided on this place because of all the reviews and buzz online.  Verdict: Damn good burger & Damn good BOOZIE milkshake!  Apparently they don't make their own onion rings which I was surprised to hear so I skipped over those.  (Wondering what else they don't make)
Friends were too "sick" to eat so got theirs to-go... but they ended up eating everything cold the next morning (yes morning) and they enjoyed it.

As good as it gets for a burger joint.

Their Gold Standard burger was exactly what a burger should be. They dry age the beef 21 days. Get it medium as the chef recommends. It's so unbelievably juicy and it melts in your mouth. The burger is simple, no gimmick, no super weird ingredients to put a spin on things. It's a burger plain, simple and perfect.

The beer and liquor selection is also top notch. In a town where beer is likely bud, bud, coors, and sam adams, this place differentiates itself with a unique worldly selection that any beer enthusiast can appreciate. Cocktails also were of the crafted nature, taking from the mixology trend and delivering to their customers something unique, tasty and made with attention to detail. 

Ambiance is great. It's a an open layout with spot lighting on each table allowing you to really enjoy the aesthetics of culinary delight with your eyes before heartily enjoying them with your taste buds.

Went there for late light dinner after a show. We got caesar salad, ahi tuna sliders and fries along with a few drinks. My date got draft beer and I got a cocktail. The cocktail was sweet, not too strong and I really liked it. The caesar salad was flavorful and just the right portion. The fries were also good drunk food. The sliders were okay.

So we decided to go here our last day at the cosmopolitan before heading back down to LA, and i have to say, it was a very good decision.

Service:
excellent.  our waiter was always around while we were looking through the menu to give us suggestions and answer any questions and was very knowledgeable of the menu.  drinks were always full and extra sauce was brought out fast

Atmosphere:
a little casual and kicked back feeling, but still a little more fancy than most casual places just due to how it felt in the restaurant probably because of the lighting and the layout

Food:  (the most important part, right?)
I will start out by saying that if you have ever been to Unami, it is very much like that, but i felt it was even better.  I got the gold standard burger, and it was very good.  the patty had that great fluffy texture and not super packed like at most burger places which made it extra juicy.  the tomato mix they put on it made it very much like bruschetta and was a nice change from just a plain old tomato.  the arugula on it added a nice bitter taste to contrast with the tomato and meat, along  with the bite from the goat cheese cheddar that they put on.  just to throw it out there, the goat cheese threw me for a loop because i am used to goat cheese being very soft like it usually is, but the goat cheese cheddar on the burger was a pretty hard texture, almost like a parmesan but it still had that amazing goat cheese taste.  the bun was to me a standard type bun that you would expect at a gourmet burger place, but it was toasted just right and soaked up the juice from the burger patty very well.  I also got an order of the shoestring fries which were seasoned perfectly that i didn't even bother asking for anything to do them in (i usually dip my fries in blue cheese dressing).  the fries were very crispy since they were pretty thin, but salted perfectly and there was a decent sized portion of them also.

the only thing that wasn't super awesome to me was the prices (i believe the gold standard was around $17) but for typical vegas prices, it isn't too bad.  and considering it was bigger and better than unami for around the same price, it isn't that big of a deal.  I will return again to try something different off the menu.

Talk about Kitsch! This place was adorable! We didn't know what to expect when we stopped in for lunch. We were seated in back and looked over the menu while we marveled at the art on the wall. Pickles with boobs kind of amused us greatly. 

I wasn't terribly hungry, so I ordered the sliders, and at 13.00, I got three small burgers, topped with Brioche buns and pickles, mustard and grilled onions. Each about the size of a silver dollar. My friend, a school teacher, ordered the salad with Salmon. She said her food was done perfectly, and we got a side of sweet potato fries. 

Everything was great, except the -already drunk- douchebros behind us who were SO very loud and so VERY annoying that it made it hard for us to enjoy the rest of our meal. People like that.. *UGH* 

Over all, I'd love to come back and re-explore the location. I'll have to come back again!

Stopped here with some friends! Not a bad place! Burgers were tasty. Not too large and not too small. But the fries that come with you meal weren't so good. It didn't taste as fresh, and when it was brought to us, the fries were a bit soggy. It might have been sitting in the kitchen for some time before it made it to the table. 

Maybe later on in the near future will give it another try.

This is the best restaurant in Vegas for burgers...hands down!!! This blows Gordon Ramsey's burger joint OUT OF THE WATER!!  The burgers are the best I have ever had...milkshakes to die for!! This is MUST do!!

Holsteins really does not need my review but I need to talk about my affinity for Holsteins. My family and I got there at around 11:45 am. Not exactly lunch time yet so it was pretty spacious and not packed. HOlsteins has complimentary popcorn but our server was a bit tardy compared to other servers & their tables. So at first, we saw popcorn on nearly every other table and were wondering what's so special about the popcorn that got so many people to order it as their appetizer? Then we realized it's complimentary when our server brought it out pretty late. Not a huge complaint but just saying.

I got the steakhouse burger and I was pretty satisfied. The burgers are said to be 6 oz, which I find is just right. There are some people on this yelp page who say the size isn't that great and it was not big. But I mean what more do you want? it's 6 oz. I mean yeah sure 8 oz burger is bigger but for a burger, 6 oz was just right. After consuming a 6 oz burger, you don't feel disgustingly full. It's not too much beef and not too much unhealthy food. 6 oz is just right. Any more is just not necessary. Sweet potato fries were good. The steakhouse burger is pepper-crusted and comes with a tomato confit. Excellent burger. I loved it but I wouldn't recommend it. Let me clarify. I do not regret getting it. I do not think it was a bad burger. But it wouldn't be one I would recommend to others. I didn't personally feel it was indicative of Holsteins' caliber. So although I enjoyed it and it tasted great, I just wouldn't get it again. 

My sister got the rising sun burger and I thought the tempura avocado and the teriyaki glaze was fantastic. They really made the entire thing a masterpiece. The tempura avocado was unique and just burst on your taste buds. Teriyaki glaze gave it a nice taste. The burgers we ordered were all juicy, not dry. We had high praise for Holsteins. 

Holsteins has a lot more on its menu than BurGR. I love Gordon Ramsay but his menu pales in comparison to here. Also, my god, the shake was fantastic. We got the turtle pecan cheesecake or whatever it was. It was absolutely magnificent. Not overly sweet. It just really was an explosion of several layers of flavor that fit together really well. I definitely recommend this shake. Just absolutely tasty and I want another shake from Holsteins. We looked around and a myriad of other tables ordered shakes too. They're a very great aspect of the restaurant. So, get a shake along with a burger! 

Service was okay. Not too impressive. Not friendly enough. The place is pricy. I don't deny that but hey it's Vegas. Did you expect to get cheap burgers? Tbh, I'm pretty content with paying the price for my steakhouse burger though. It's a bit pricy but they deliver on flavor. 

I'll definitely be back, Holsteins!

The burgers are bomb af and the shakes are even better! Get the red velvet alcohol shake. They're so filling and so good! Definitely a place I recommend to try. Just be aware the burgers are like $15-20 but they're so good.

The first time we tried to go the wait was too long, so it is a popular place. The second time was a less busy day and time so we got a table. The alcohol milkshakes were a fun treat for a weekend in vegas with many different selections like dark chocolate and cookies and cream. I also tried one of the mini-burgers but it was small and maybe difficult to make a patty that size very juicy, so I would go with the full sized burger next time. Most of the food on the menu was burgers and fries so go if that is what you are in the mood for and you want a lot of options in that category. The prices are steep, about $15 burgers and $10 alcoholic milkshakes, but that is nothing on the strip, and the location, decor, atmosphere, and service are great.

This is now on my list as one of the best restaurants I've dined at in Vegas, and one of the best burgers I've ever had. My friend and I split the Gold Standard and were shocked to find out we could order it with a house-made gluten-free bun (score!). We also split the Moscow Moo milkshake with an extra shot of vodka for good measure. Our server Fabrixio (AKA Fab) was just that (fab) and even brought us out some extra goodies, including a creme de menthe meringue infused with liquid nitrogen at the end of the meal. When you bite into it, green "smoke" comes out of your mouth - so cool and super minty and refreshing. Highly recommended!

The last time we visited Vegas it seemed like every casino added a gourmet burger type place to their restaurant collection. There is ABX American Burger in Excalibur, BLT Burger in Mirage and Gordon Ramsay BurGR in Planet Hollywood just to name a few. This time we decided to try Holsteins for their adult milkshakes. Also my husband had been here before so of course I had to try it after all his rants and raving.

We came in for dinner on a Friday evening around 5:30pm. It wasn't too busy so we were seated right away. After taking some time to decide I went with the Rising Sun Burger and Oreo Shake. The burger was one of the best I've had of it's kind. It wasn't as big as burger from Red Robin but remember its quality over quantity. The patty was fresh and juicy, cooked medium as requested. The Rising Son had Kobe Beef, Teriyaki Glaze, Nori Furikake, Crispy Yam, Spicy Mayo, and Tempura Avocado  The fries were crisp, golden, hand cut thick fries. I liked that they stayed crispy and weren't oily.

The Oreo shake tasted good but didn't seem to stand out from anything else I had before. I didn't even feel any of the alcohol. Maybe it was because I was full from eating or needed a double shot since the alcohol was Bailey's Irish Cream.

The restaurant was clean and service outstanding. Burgers are a little pricey but your getting a way better quality burger than Red Robin and hey it's Vegas! If anything stop in and have a shake. The shake menu is pretty extensive and I haven't heard anything bad about any of them myself. The other two shakes ordered at our table that night were the Creme Brulee and Black Cow. My husband says S'mores is still his favorite.   Whether or not I'm staying the Cosmopolitan the next time I visit I'd eat here again.

Solid 4 of a burger. Not the worlds best nor at good as the ones you could find at Bobby's (you know who I mean) place. You would expect a much more of a place that is trying to be so unique. I think places like this press the patty too hard and over cook it just a tad.

Amazing burgers!!!  Honestly, the BEST burger I've ever had.  A true chef's creative touch makes these burgess extra special. The Fun-Ghi was the best!!  My husband had the Salmon burger and the sashimi on top of the grilled filet of salmon was the special touch making it fabulous. Kids ate every last bite on their plate as well... CA turkey burger and kids sliders. Will be back if we end up in Vegas next year!

The restaurant is very easy to find and is a lot bigger than it looks. I made a reservation for lunch time and was seating right when I checked in. The waiter proceeded to give us recommendations and then let us have some time to decide what to order.

I knew they were popular for burgers and shakes so thats exactly what I ordered. The strawberry shake was fantastic!! They gave a huge amount and even a left over cup with some extra. I was able to share the shake and it was plenty for the two of us. As for the burger I got one with chicken and it was outstanding!! The toppings and sauces were all a wonderful compliment. 

Overall a great place to grab a bite to eat at the Cosmo. If you check in on Yelp they give you 50% off select draft beers which is a great perk! Also you get free popcorn with pizza seasoning instead of the typical bread most restaurants serve.

The burger I had here was amazing - one of the best I've ever had. I don't remember what it was called but it had crispy yams, teriyaki sauce, and fried avocado. We came back later for a boozy milkshake and also enjoyed that. The service is a little spotty, but overall a great place and I'd definitely go back.
Great food. Burgers to big, what kind of complaint is that?  5 stars on taste, 3stars on price for the 4 star average.  Great shakes, very loud. Recommend.

Prior to coming, my friends were telling me their burgers and shakes were amazing. I wasn't disappointed, nor was I thrilled. Nothing too "OMG" 

Service\/ambiance: I came for a late lunch on a Saturday and there was no wait. Probably because of the odd hour dining. But the service here was great. Anytime we needed something we were helped and the waiters were all so friendly. As for the atmosphere it was very relaxing and just a great hang out place for my friends and I to come and enjoy our food and each other's company.

Food:
-Check in for your free beer! The beer (I forgot the name...sorry!) was just any draft beer. I shared with everyone so we could all try. Nothing strong so it's a good beer everyone could enjoy.

-Nom Nom Burger: This was recommended to me by our waitress. I like! It has some extra crispy chips inside (which surprisingly stayed in my burger the whole time, I tend to struggle). I really liked the chips inside. It gave the burger a nice little pizazz. The burger itself wasn't exactly super juicy, just your average burger. Very flavorful though! I just like it more on the juicier side, which I guess wouldn't work out too well with the chips. Either way, I'd definitely get this again if I were to come back

-Milkshakes (in general): I tried several and all of them were good. We ordered the ones with alcohol which I couldn't taste so that's good. They weren't shakes I would get to try to get a buzz so I'm not sure the additional alcohol is even worth it. But they did taste good!

Overall, I was just meh about the whole experience. Nothing bad, nothing great. I'd come back if I'm in the area. Not something I'm DYING to come back for though.

Extremely attractive burger joint at the Cosmo....but why are these places so noisy? Guess I'm not the youthful demographic these places covet. Nothing wrong with Holsteins. The food and the service are just fine..its just always loud  and seemingly always crowded. My son and I each had the Nom Nom burger...kobe beef with cheddar cheese, potato chips and 1000 island dressing. It was delicious. My wife had the California turkey and gave it a thumbs UP. my daughter had the classic burger and enjoyed it as well. fries come free with big bun burgers like we ordered. prices are what you'd expect from a high end casino. We all enjoyed ourselves..just please turn down the volume!

The waiters and waitresses are really nice, and the management are nice. Overall, I would say the burger is nice, but since it was located inside the Cosmopolitan right across from Marquee night club, it was extremely noisy and the burger was slightly more pricey considering it was on the strip of Las Vegas. I paid about 22 bucks for a burger fries tips and taxes included. The burger itself was 18ish for a burger and fries.

The thing that initially drew me to Holsteins was that I needed a place for dinner at the Cosmopolitan that was more budget friendly than China Poblano and Jaleo. When the bill arrived I'm not so sure we saved much, but at least our belly's were full. 

No particular dish my group ordered stood out as amazing 'must try.' I had the Steakhouse burger. It was good but a little too greasy for my liking. My friend ordered the Urth Burger. I had a few bites and found it quite bland. I was also disappointed that my sweet potato fries were lukewarm. The item I was most impressed with we're the onion rings. The onion was cut thick and generously battered.
