Average at best. Debated taking an extra star off due to our bartender serving me a "mixed" beer. A place that serves craft beer should know what to do when a keg runs out. Not our bartender. The keg needed to be changed about 1\/4 of way into pour of my glass. Does he say, "we are changing the keg, and your beer will be out in a minute, would you like some water while you wait?" Nope. He continues to pour foam into the glass and let it settle, squeezing out every ounce from the keg. Finally, he tops the last 1\/4 of my beer with new beer, grabs a straw, and stirs the beer, hoping I won't notice. 10 minutes later I get a bottom of keg soured beer with no head. He says, "I'll take it off the bill because of the wait." I couldn't even drink the beer it was so off tasting. Needless to say, won't be back. The food isn't good enough. In Vegas, I'd rather go somewhere with better service and food. Too many great options to settle for mediocre.

I had their weekday special. Chips with their special dip, black and white shake and the gold standard burger with fries. Oh yeah, some popcorn.   Popcorn was free but you have to ask for it.  The burger was half a pound. That's huge. Too much food for me. Our server was excellent. It's a bit pricey but this is Vegas.

Day 1 of vegas I first experienced heaven in the form of a cereal bar shake. Day 2 I was having shaky withdrawals. Day 3 I came back and tried an oreo shake and was disappointed because it didn't wow me like the cereal did and had to end up stealing unsatisfying sips form my bf who stuck with what he liked. 

The chocolate and oreo shake couldn't compare. If I was offered a box of cereal and a box of oreos, I'd most likely go for the oreos. But in the case of the shakes, cereal bar blew me away. 

The Rising Sun Burger was pretty good, but what I liked more was the Crispy Pork Belly Buns. The lobster mac and cheese was great with a fair amount of lobster. For $16, I wished they would've given more mac. The photos make it look bigger than it actually is. That, or my bf ate most of it when I was drunk off the shake. The burger is huge though.

And HOLY CUTE who did their artwork? A pig in a pink spotted cow costume?? Genius and oh so so adorable.

[Out-of-Towner Review]

When you are so tempted to steal your neighbors IG worth drink for a pic...

...but you don't! She was more than willing to share for my pic, but I felt weird posting something I didn't order, nor did my table.

This spot came recommended from a friend when I did a crowd sourcing for eateries in Vegas via FB (gees, this is a social media laden post)! On our way to Egg Slut a couple days prior, I noticed it and noted how close it was to our hotel.

That being said, they seriously know how to create their adult milk shakes here. They are so elaborate and look amazing! This isn't to say that their food isn't bad either, its pretty good.

To start we ordered the Poutine --french fries, cheese curds, shredded short rib, & stout gravy. The french fries were crispy and the shredded short rib was really, really good. Tender and flavorful, just lacking in quantity. The stout gravy came on the side and it wasn't my favorite, although I did use some to try it. I'm pretty sure I just wanted a more creamy gravy, this one was more like a thin liquid.

For my entree I ordered the Gold Standard -- Dry aged beef sirloin burger w\/ smoked bacon, aged goat cheddar cheese, tomato confit, baby arugula, & garlic-chive aioli. I asked for the tomato confit to be on the side and never even added it to the burger. Oh man, I'm glad I decided to try this place. This burger, just the patty alone, was so flavorful and ahhh-mazing! The bacon was tasty and delicious, but I really loved the bun. The aioli was good, but it didn't make or break my burger.

The burgers are pretty big. We all wished we would have shared between the three of us, in some magical way. The Parentals ordered their own, unfortunately I can't remember what they ordered. Everyone was happily devouring their burgers and had no complaints.

I wanted to order one of those fancy shakes, but didn't really like any of the flavors. However, I did order a Chocolate shake with no whip. The disappointment of how aesthetically pleasing it was in comparison the others was palpable. It tasted great, but it still left me craving the awesomeness of the others.

Our server was awesome the entire time, she was on top of everything. As was the bus boy\/dude that stopped by a few times. We chose to sit in the bar area, so we could watch one of their four TVs, because the Giants were playing in the NLDS. We decided to forgo a regular table and used a coffee table instead, which meant plates on our laps for our burgers. Momma Bear was such a trooper, she sat in this setting with her back to the game so we could watch.

The atmosphere is fun, kinda quirky, and the images along one wall remind me of Warhol-esque style. The prices are what you'd expect in Vegas for alcoholic milkshakes and quality burgers. As long as you know that before hand you'll enjoy your experience.

I'm still annoyed I didn't order one of those cool shakes...

Been here twice, review is purely for the milkeshakes:

After a disastrous dinner, alcoholic milkshake seemed the way to go!

Chocolate Turtle Milkshake was truly delicious.
 Definitely hits the spot when you want a full flavored dessert. You can taste the alcohol but it's not over powering. Shareable between 3-4people. 

-1 star for wait\/service :(

Holstein's is conveniently located in the Cosmopolitan where we stayed. The burgers are high quality and one of the best I've had, though they are a bit pricey. Then again, everything in Vegas is expensive, so it was one of our more reasonable dining options. The service was good but slow, but then again we were with a group of 10 people. A few of us ordered the alcoholic milk shakes which were pretty awesome. Overall this is definitely a great place to check out if you're looking for a casual and reasonably priced meal on the Vegas strip!

I've been here a few times. I've had the Fun-ghi burger, the Lobster Mac and Cheese, and the Asian-themed Kobe beef burger. They were all fantastically crafted with unique flavor so complex that you forget you're eating a burger. 

The fries and onion rings are amazing, but the variety of adult milkshakes and 100 beers they offer really make this place a destination. 

In the Cosmopolitan Hotel, filled with a dozen $75+ a person dinner restaurants, this place sets itself apart for its laid back atmosphere and great flavor for a more reasonable price (for Vegas, that is)

Had lunch today and here is what I thought.

Staff is nice, from front to back super friendly and great service. The acoustic was a bit loud but doable.

Had the steak\/thai salad and it was good but not great, tasted good, small portion and seemed just like it was thrown together, but again not bad.

To sum up, service grey, food ok, decent ambience, I would try again.

The Gold Standard burger definitely lives up to its name. It is juicy and tender and was cooked to a perfect medium rare that I ordered. So much flavor in every bite, it was so enjoyable. I'm also a fan of their crispy cooked French fries as well. 
I got the A-chocolypse shake to finish off the meal, and that was one of the best calls I made all weekend. So much chocolatey goodness. 

We sat at the bar which was comfortable, and the waitress was very friendly. Props to them with some of the obnoxious attitudes they have to put up with from some people.

Don't forget to check in on Yelp and get a free drink with your meal. Good deal!

Great fun spot to visit when you're in Vegas. On the 2nd floor of the Cosmopolitan Hotel. Great burgers, shakes, appetizers. For a small group or large party. 
Jake our waiter was quick and very helpful. 

The bar has some great bartenders and lounge area. Onion rings are excellent. Enjoy.

I have been here twice now on separate trips to Vegas. Service is slow but ok and prices are reasonable (come on people, it's the strip). 

Burgers are sooooo delicious and the skinny fries are great! The "hen house" was a huge hit at our table :) My only complaint is that I wanted to substitute avocado for the bacon that came with my burger and they wanted to charge me. Both are priced at $2 on the "extras" menu, so I feel like reasonably, they should be able to make the substitution without charging, but hey, that's the restaurant business.

i had the Billionaire Burger and I thought my mouth was in heaven.Kobe Beef, Foie Gras, Port Onion Marmalade, Frisee, Truffle Mayonnaise...These ingredients come together and create the perfect combination of...oh that's right, perfection.  Enjoy it!  we also had the S'mores Milkshake, SOOOOO delicious.  Great wine selection available for those of you who want to enjoy your billionaire burger the way that it's supposed to be enjoyed.

AMAZING. 

This place has to be one of the best burger places I've encountered. 

I had the crispy pork belly bun, the rising sun, the gold standard, onion rings and fried pickles. We all ordered this to share and I got a chance of trying everything, and honestly, nothing disappointed. 

The fried pickles exceeded my expectations by far. They were pickle spears battered and deep fried with an aioli dipping sauce. 

The crispy pork belly bun was full of flavor and the meat was so tender. 

The onion rings were fried just right and had the right texture and crunch without being overly oily. 

The burgers were on another level. Though each burger had many different components, it all worked so well together. I cannot wait to come back and try other burgers. 

This place is a must stop every time I am in Vegas now.

In my quest to try the best burgers on the west coast, I came here with friends recently to give it a try while on vacation. The decor was really cute (I never comment on stuff like this, so the fact that it caught my eye means a lot). Burgers were pretty good, nothing off the charts amazing, but I'd go with the Rising Sun burger (Gold Standard was probably second best). Sides were somewhat overdone, but not terrible either. The savoir of this place was the milkshakes. DEAR GOD SO GOOD. 4 of us split the campfire smores and the raspberry lemon cheesecake, both were amazing. You knew there was alcohol in there, but the shakes weren't overpowered by the alcohol (or by the sugary stuff to cover up the booze) I'd definitely recommend this place, if for nothing else the milkshakes

Deeeeelish! But you may feel too bloated, too sluggish, too lardy to be productive. But you'll feel very satisfied you had a yummy meal. (Though, at $76 for lunch, we could have done without a few dishes. More on that later.)

My husband and I went on a Sunday morning at 11:05 after they first opened for the day. We got seated right away at a table near the flat screens to watch the games, but within 10 or 15 minutes, the place was jam packed with diners. 

Here's a rundown of what we ordered: All very well executed, though would have benefitted from a few minor changes. Fun novelty items too. 

1. Fried Pickles: loved this preparation, because these fried pickles are spears, not chips that fall apart and taste nothing like a pickle. This gives each bite a nice tang. Flavorful sauce condiment and nice touch to have sliced meats on the side. Also came with fried olives ad fried capers...though the capers were kinda dried and tasteless. 

2. Crispy Pork Belly Bun : Steamed mantou type buns (two mini sized) and two large chunks of crispy pork belly and hoisin. Very, very good,  I've had variations of this dish many times, and this one is nice. Very fatty, very crisp and flavorful. Though. I'd appreciate more cilantro, and some acid to cut through the fat. 

3. Rising Sun Burger: juicy and hot, slathered in sauce, kimchi and a fried egg...get your napkins! Just get is. That's all I have to say about this one. 

4. Tenderloin Rossini: pork tend loin sliders with foie gras (sp? I dunk, I dot eat enlarged duck liver...is that right, very often!) was good...but as always with tenderloin, desperately needed some fat. Came with house made chips, but would have preferred fries or rings. 

5. Cake Lollypop, Nitrogen Merangues, (SP?) Push Pop: Strawberry cheesecake Lollypop was delicious, dipped in white chocolate and had a small strawberry gel disc on top. The nitro meringue (SP?) is bubblegum flavored, and  tiny, but prepared tableside and more for show than anything. Blow smoke for 30 seconds and impress your friends! For $2 it's a fun way to end a meal. The push pop...overrated. Nice novelty, but the sorbet is hard and makes it difficult to eat. Cute concept though. 

Service rocked. Glasses always full, plates cleared as soon as we were finished. Warm environment, creative menu items. Would hit up again...and would try the long list of milkshakes!

Sure, the food tastes pretty good here - especially when you're drunk and hungry, but let's be honest, any burger would be satisfying at that point. Overpriced, terrible service, snooty atmosphere, and too crowded. Spend your money elsewhere - there are plenty of places to eat in Vegas

I was looking for a burger place on here, with this many reviews & 4 stars of course I had to try it!
Very happy I did. Wow. 
Yes I understand it's a burger some might even say they all taste the same. No, no they do not. 
I've tried many of the celebrity burger restaurants and they didn't impress me as much as this place did. 
I got the nom nom burger which is Kobe beef cus it was one a couple bucks more than the regular burger. Delicious and it was massive I wasn't even close to finishing it. It also comes with fries which were a lot. 

I also got the buffalo chicken dip. Highly recommend my boyfriend & I were fighting to see who can eat it faster. 

Definitely worth the try.

Yup.  All that and a shake.  Best meal I have had in Vegas for the last few trips.  I had the Rising Sun and in my normal fashion wanted to opt out of an ingredient and was recommended not to as the tastes were meant to be together.  I could not agree more - the best, most unique, tastiest burger ever.  Fries were great, onion rings tasty and drinks divine.  I'm super glad I went and you will be too.

Holstein's is a must if one finds himself in Las Vegas. Granted I was in an "altered" state of mind, but damn, words don't do this place justice. If the phrase, "too much flavor" ever had a face, it would be Mr. Holstein himself. My friend and I both had the gold standard and it definitely lived up to that standard. Savory, fresh, and rich. Don't miss out friends! Indulgence has a new location and it's at the 2nd floor of the Cosmopolitan hotel in Las Vegas.

Let me just cut to the chase on this review, DO NOT EAT HERE. I love fine dining and have no problem dropping a good amount of money on a good meal, but I've never had a worse dining experience than at Holsteins. With that being said, let me explain myself.

I had been to Holsteins once before my nightmare of an experience with them, and had a decent experience, the food was good, but none of the visit was anything noteworthy. On my second visit we came to celebrate a friend's 21st birthday, her having chose the venue. We were all dressed up and went to Holsteins sparing no expense and had plans to go to Marquee Monday after dinner. We were seated promptly, and all was well. We then each ordered several drinks, burgers, appetizers, shakes, you name it, and we were all just getting into our meals when our waiter came to fill our water glasses. As he filled our water glasses he accidentally knocked one over, spilling water onto my meal as well as my friend next to me.  We jumped back, as the water was ice cold and we were surprised. He panicked and then promptly began to mop up the water. As he did so, he leaned heavily on our table and the table toppled over, knocking our drinks and food into my friends lap, as well as mine. My friend was wearing white pants, so their cranberry and vodka and my birthday cake cocktail made their white pants look like a menstrual accident. Our waiter went to retrieve some towels, and another staff member tried to bring towels as well. The pants were not salvageable, nor was my barely touched meal. I had ordered a burger and fries, a 13 or 14 dollar cocktail, and an appetizer, all of which were destroyed. I'd only had a sip of my cocktail, less than half of my burger, and just a mere fried pickle before my food was doused with cocktails and spilled into our laps. Our waiter apologized, but no solution was offered. No one asked if they could replace our soiled, inedible meals, or offered to cover our portion of the bill.

I work in a company that prides itself on flawless customer service, and was appalled at the response I received. We were handed our bills and nothing more was said. My friend and I were livid! Any half decent restaurant manager would have comped our entire party and apologized profusely, but he didn't even come to see our party and apologize when the waiter informed him of the situation. We payed our bill and I asked the hostess to see the manager. He came out to talk to me and was the epitome of a young, overly confident prick. I recanted the story of what happened at our table and he stared blanky at me until I finished speaking. His exact words were "I am sorry about the inconvenience, but I saw the whole thing happen, and it was you guys moving the table that caused it." 

At this point I was seething with rage. I told him that he wasn't even on the restaurant floor when it happened, and that we had completely leaned away from the table witht the initial spill. He just stared at me with glazed eyes, and nodded his head. I then told him that I knew he really didn't care what I was saying and I didn't appreciate him being patronizing rather than showing any form of empathy. Words cannot describe how horrific this manager was, and because of his lack of any sense I will never give any of my business to this restaurant ever again. I'm quite frankly floored that such an incredible establishment like the Cosmopolitan would allow such people to run one of their restaurants.

All I can say is don't waste your time, the service alone makes this establishment boycott worthy. Save your money and eat elsewhere on the strip. I've heard horror stories about strip eateries, but I've never heard or experienced one as ghastly nightmarish as this.  So again, DO NOT EAT HERE.

Stopped by here for dinner after finding it impossible to get into Mandalay Bay to go to Fleur.  Is Calle 13 really that popular?

John Curtas claimed that Holsteins pork belly buns were almost as good as Momofuku's in NYC (http:\/\/www.eatinglv.com\/2010\/12\/holsteins-has-got-it-goin-on\/) so we had to try them out.  A lemon meringue shake and a Korean burger rounded out the order.  My husband and I were starving from driving around Mandalay Bay and Luxor for an hour trying to find parking and getting stuck in traffic.   Our very nice server quickly took our order.

The food came out very, very fast.  Which was great but also a little disconcerting.  They can cook that fast?  LBS, Holsteins sister restaurant at Red Rock Casino, takes forever!  And we weren't the only ones.  Our neighbors all got their food within 5 minutes of ordering.  Crazy.

The pork buns are NOT "almost as good" as Momofuku's.  Not even close.  Maybe because Holsteins can see John Curtas coming a mile a way in his all-white suit, he got a better version.  But these were just ok.

The Korean burger had a good flavor to it but there was too much liquid involved and the bottom bun was pretty soggy.

The lemon meringue shake stole the show.  It's sounds weird but salted caramel in a lemon shake with Grand Marnier - brilliant!

We figured our modest order and half-starved state would leave us enough room to try the infamous China Poblano next door. We were wrong.  The fat content of the food combined with the shake made us full very quickly. 

I like the service and the concept and the shakes.  I am definitely a fan.

Kobe burgers, delicious milkshakes and fun decor, oh my!  A carnivore's delight!

First time trying their super tender Billionaire Burger that has Kobe patty in it and it was amazing!  It just melts in your mouth and doesn't require so much chewing!  Order that with their finely, thick batter-fried up onion rings and creamy, freshly made milkshake so it will be the perfect combo!

Service was good, but DJ music was played too loud during the late night hours!  I couldn't hear myself!  Well, then again, I guess it is Vegas after all so this place has to be loud to get some ratchet attention!

Steak and kimchi quesadillas were the booooommmbbbb. Cubano tacos were ok. Onion rings were super tasty. Fun atmosphere, ok service. Oh, if you can get the black beans that come with the cubano tacos, do it. They were better than the tacos by far. Ill take a bowl of those masterpieces.

Eh this place was alright. We ended up going here because the wait at Gordon Ramsey's burger place was insane! The burgers were pretty good but definitely not anything special. We did like the alcoholic cookies and cream shake...fair warning, it's HUGE!

didn't plan on eating here but didn't do me any wrong after deciding to eat their delicious burger and yummy fries. 

they have one of the best burger in the strip and its absolutely one of the best burger ever since my boyfriend finished it all. shoe string fries were yummy like no other. their ho ho dessert, presentation is pretty and the taste divine. all and all place is an a+. 

may i add, instead of giving you bread...they give popcorn. something new is always grrreat :)

would come back here!

YUM!

This is what we ordered:

1. Greener Pastures w\/ a side of beef brisket
2. The Classic Burger on Wheat Buns
3. A Bellini
4. A vodka tonic

Salad was delicious! Beef Brisket SUPER tender. Burger order was actually a bit wrong (wrong bread wrong cheese), but my boyfriend didn't realize til half way through because it was that good. Onion Rings - delish! Drinks were delicious. And they bring you a can of popcorn at the end of your meal. Score! 

Our server Chaz was also awesome.

We heard about the burgers here from reviews written online so we decided to try it out after a movie poolside at the Cosmopolitan.  

We ordered: 

Billionaire Burger - Kobe Beef, Foie Gras, Port Onion Marmalade, Frisee, Truffle Mayo 
----For $30 ($2 for added mushrooms) this burger was just okay.  Foie gras was kind of small, burger was cooked medium-well instead of well.   Came with side of fries.  

I prefer the Rossini at Burger Bar.  At double the price it's kind of high, but the taste is 5 times better.  

'THE RISING SUN'  - Kobe Beef, Teriyaki Glaze, Nori Furikake, Crispy Yam, Spicy Mayo & Tempura Avocado

$17 - Tempura avocado was huge, bigger than the burger and it looked awkward and hard to eat.  Bun seems hard to balance on top of it.  Otherwise it was not a bad burger as well. 

TRUFFLE LOBSTER 'MAC N CHEESE'  - Creamy Tallegio-Mascarpone Sauce With Maine Lobster And Black Truffle

$16.50 - Enjoyed this the most but Lobster Me does this better.   The single potato chip w\/ lobster that comes with the mac and cheese plate was a great addition to this.  Should be it's own appetizer.

Strawberry milkshake ($8)  over priced, standard milkshake.   

Servers were friendly  and accommodating.

Service is always on point. They're fast, friendly, and funny.

Eating here before the Adele concert was a savior because I really didn't feel like eating at a higher end restaurant at Cosmo. Just something easy and nothing formal.

I had their tenderloin rossini which were sliders with tenderloin, foie gras, and mushrooms. Meat was bigger than the buns. Super juicy. And I could taste the foie but, couldn't see it. I was dissappointed with that cause when I'm eating foie, disgusting as it may sound, I like to see the fat coming out of it.

Pizza rolls were like those pizza bites but, I'd rather have pizza bites. lol

Got here around 6pm on a Thursday and was told our wait was around 25 mins. The hostess told us we can wait or leave our number just in case we decide to walk around. I left my number with her and decided to just wait there as well. After 25 mins, I decided to go up to the host stand and ask how much longer seeing people after us were being seated. The guy told me they put down the wrong number and that our table had been ready but didn't bother to walk 5 ft outside or ask for my name.

Service 3\/5 - Service was okay. Although the waiter did recommend things to go with our burger when we were ordering, we rarely saw him. He came by to refill my water once and then back again when we needed the check. I understand it gets busy here but he seemed all over the place and the busboy ended up helping us more.

Food 5\/5 - My bf got the Gold Standard and Coffee & Donuts shake while I got the Nom Nom Burger and Cookies & Cream shake. The burgers were cooked really well but I felt like the chips on my Nom Nom Burger tasted stale and just took them off. The fries that came with them were good but after that I was so full I could barely finish my shake. The shakes we got supposedly have alcohol in them but you don't taste any, however they did taste good for regular shakes. 

The atmosphere was fun and modern with cartoon cows all over the place. There's also a bar if you wanted to grab drinks and I liked that they offer smaller tables near the front for drinks. 

Overall, I would come back for the food and hope they work on their service.

Dropped in here one evening as my brother, gf and I were casino hopping and had dinner..WOW..I have had some yummy burgers but I did not expect to be blown away like this..absofrigginlutely amazing.

We ordered some rings and fries to share and the portions were just right, they even brough us a small bucket of popcorn to munch on, a very nice twist..

But, even better was the service..Nice, fast, professional, funny..

Super fun and cute burger joint inside Cosmopolitan that will have me coming back for their Bamboozled Shakes!  Anytime you stick a menu in front of my face with a large selection of shakes with alcohol, I am impressed.  The handsome and friendly waiter suggested Gold Standard burger since he claimed  it has been named the best burger in Vegas.  For $17 I was hoping for some magical taste bud explosion but unfortunately it disappointed.  It was good enough but not something to be given a blue ribbon for.  I couldn't finish the bun as it was too much bun for the burger and didn't enhance the flavor.  The burger does come with fries so that helps with the cost a bit (a tad).  The standouts are the shakes.  Ohh yeah...ice cream deliciousness topped with an insane amount of fresh whipped cream.  Next time I am in town, I am coming here just for a shake or two!

Way overpriced for a below average burger. I had the gold standard burger, just not that good. My friend got the salmon burger (can't remember the name for it). The best thing he could say about it was that it was edible. Service was good, and it was a nice place.

I'm a fan of Holsteins; it's absolutely one of the best burgers I've ever had. Every time I go I tell myself I'm going to try something new, but I never do- I'm a "Gold Standard" kind of girl and this burger is it for me. Great fries too and my husband says they make an excellent shake. There's usually a wait and it's not cheap, but totally worth it!

Adult milkshake!! yum....the pumpkin pie shake tastes just like a pumpkin pie...I guess they use real pumpkin pie puree inside!

Got the salmon burger, it was good but a little too salty for my tastes

$17 salmon burger wasn't too bad since it was a pretty big piece of salmon with more salmon lox on top with fries....the $13 shake seems like it subsidizes the lower fish cost...good to try once, wouldn't come back

happy Vegas-ing!

Been to Vegas countless times this year and have eaten at Holsteins no less than 5 times. Food is great, and I think the prices are totally fair for the food. From what I can remember we've tried the chopped salad from the GRAZE menu, meat ball, beef, and there was once some sort of steak and arugula grinders that were highly priced but more than worth it on the TINY BUNS menu, California turkey from the BIG BUNS menu, every type of fries they offer, and a few other things I can't remember... Everything is always shockingly good and our drinks are always stiff. Much love Holsteins.

We once had a less than perfect experience which was immediately taken care of by the manager in a very timely, polite and caring way. This is why there are no stars missing from my review... The way our concerns were addressed and taken care of was highly notable and appreciated.

Very pricey menu for burgers but then again you are in Vegas. Food is very good and they have a very good selection of drinks. This is my favorite burger place in Vegas though and a definite must for any burger lovers

Excellent.  Very friendly and quick service.  Had the Delhi chicken burger, which was Mango chutney on a grilled chicken breast that was perfectly cooked and seasoned.  Would give it 5 stars but it was a bit too pricey.  Paid $30 for a burger and a beer. ($25 plus tip. They got the full 20% for being so nice!).
Arrived at lunch time and there was a waiting list for tables, but could go straight to the bar which had the full menu.

Located inside the Cosmopolitan Las Vegas on the second floor, this restaurant is udderly impressive!

Made it during the Social Hour (like a happy hour with special menu). Limited to bar and lounge seating. 

Got a spot at the bar and met bartender Kenny. Business has a great selection of boozy milkshakes. Social Hour menu included sharable dishes like egg rolls, sliders and buffalo chicken dip.

Items are priced well.

Milkshakes were huge! Ordered a Drunken Money with candy and taffy decorating the outside. Easy to split this shake with a friend. 

Also ordered sliders and buffalo chicken dip. Kenny didn't steer us wrong. The dip is great! A must have!

Order was quick to arrive. Fresh and yummy! Interested in exploring more of this menu on  a future visit.

The burger was great. The sweet potatoe fries good could have used something else to stand out. Great selection of draft beers along with a list of bottled beers. And the shakes AWESOME. Must do if your in Vegas

The place is nice. Good atmosphere and creative decor. Services not too bad. My boyfriend and I came here 2 days in a row we got a nom nom burger, which was good. A golden standard and burger with truffle oil and mushroom. We didn't care too much for those probably cause the cheese was too powerful for us. We ordered the burgers medium and they were seemed rare. 
Lastly for dessert we got an oreo cookie shake which was average. Unfortunately the cookie sandwich at the top was not so tastey.

I was pleasantly surprised by Holstein's. The menu is diverse and offers a wide variety of flavors. Duck confit and foie gras? Truffle mayo? How can you go wrong? And there's a large, extensive range of imported beverages, alcoholic blended milkshakes, and different sodas from around the globe. 

Service is lightning fast! The order was put in and within 5 minutes, all the food came out. And we never had to ask for anything. It's a definite must visit!

We were staying in the Cosmo and wanted a late night bite. I had this place bookmarked for quite some time, so, off we went. I odered the Rising Sun and a shake. The rising sun is an Asian fusion burger made of kobe beef, teriyaki glaze, nori furikake, crispy yam, spicy mayo, & tempura avocado; a lot goin on - I wasn't impressed. The shake was delicious.

I like the fact that they offer late night bites. However, there are just too many other great burger places to choose from. Holsteins falls flat. Perhaps I just ordered the wrong thing; it came highly recommended by our server. Regardless, I don't need to spend another $18 on a burger here only to be disappointed and unfulfilled again. I probably won't return.

Wow. Holsteins is definitely a memorable place with their flashy cartoon graphics and crazy milkshakes. You're surrounded with playfulness, regardless of it's the cow-filled interior or the food.
The hamburgers were just good, nothing more or less. I really enjoyed the rising sun, but didn't care for the other two (the fun ghi & billionaire burger) that we got. French fries and sweet potatoes were okay, nothing spectacular at all. Though, the crispy onion rings were bomb!
Now, on to the decorated milkshakes! They were all delicious (banana split, the frozen grasshopper, campfire smores), though on the sweeter side (but I mean, it's milkshakes right?). The presentation was awesome, and I think that's what makes me like their milkshakes even more. I barely ate the toppings they included in the milkshake as it was just, so. much. sugar. But, I couldn't let the milkshake go to waste and drank it all the way back to LA.
In general, the restaurant is between a 3 and 4 because it's slightly pricey ($120 total) for these fancy hamburgers and shakes that felt like way too much carbs, sugar, salt, sauce, and candy for one sitting. But I would recommend friends to try, hence the 4 star. I think it's a fun experience and worth waiting half an hour for (we went without reservations on Sunday around noon), especially with the casinos and other little stores in the Cosmopolitan.

I had the pork sliders.
Based on that i cant recommend the place.
If you're staying at the Cosmopolitan, try one of the other restaurants.
The service was good however.

This restaurant is spacious with plenty of seating.

Food
Golden standard (4\/5) - It's definitely a good old burger with bacon and good meat patty. 
El Caliente (5\/5) - OMG, from the crispy pork skin to the avocado cilantro mayo sauce...wow!
Lobster Mac and Cheese (2\/5) - Tasted bland. 
Philly Egg rolls (3.5\/5) - This was pleasantly tasty.

Was it the best burger I have ever had?  Nope, but it was darn good! I loved the location, the upscale setting, the hostess and the wait staff. All of this together provided an awesome dining experience. I definitely wanted to give a shout out to the wait staff. Being on a business trip we had a budget to stick with so we had three separate checks with both credit and cash transactions. When we told the waiter we were met with "No problem". I definitely appreciated that!
Food- The burger patty you could tell was very fresh. I think I heard a "Moo" from the kitchen! Excellent meat to bun ratio. Probably 6+ ounces or better. They really have a nice variety of topping to please everyone. The fries were very good as well. I really liked that all the shakes listed on the menu you could order with or without the booze. We opted without to capture the true flavor and they did not disappoint. 
Overall I thought for the location and the setting the price point was spot on. I think I paid right around $20 bucks for the burger and fries. My brother added the shake so it came to around $27. If I were staying at the Cosmo I would more than likely return again, but with so many burger choices around Vegas most likely I will move on to sample other spots as well. Highly recommended and worth the trip to check them out!

This place was amazing. Loved the atmosphere here and the service was fantastic. I ordered the Fungai burger and it was cooked to perfection. Melted in my mouth perfection. I didn't order a booze shake because I was too full after the burger.  The sweet potato fries and the onion rings were also delicious. Highly recommend and compared to food prices at every other place on the strip, the prices were reasonable.

Top 3 burger I've had which isn't even fair because i can't name the other 2... Had the rising sun burger. Incredible. Don't need to write you a book to say how great the burgers are here. Get off yelp and go!

Pretty cool restaurant that serves burgers and alcoholic milkshakes! The service was eh... the music they played was hiphop- clubbing type of music.

I got the salmon burger which was pretty good. It had a slice of lox on top of the cooked salmon patty which made the burger! I upgraded to the duck fat fries which was a BIG mistake. Their duck fat fries pretty much taste like regular fries. I think I would've been better off saving $2 and eating regular fries made by normal oil.

I was originally waiting in line for Wicked Spoon, but the wait was too long. I saw that Holsteins had a short wait and I've always wanted to try Holsteins' freak shake, so I jumped out of the buffet waiting line and went to Holsteins instead!

*'Urth' vegan burger (5\/5): This burger was out of this world good! Totally incomparable to the vegan burgers I've tried at other restaurants. Their vegan patty is "housemade" which is what makes it so unique and delicious! Their vegan patty was so amazing! Definitely on my "Best Vegan Foods to Try" list! Any vegans, vegetarians, or maybe even meat lovers would love this burger! 

*Cookies & Cream (4\/5): A MILKSHAKE WITH AN ENTIRE ICE CREAM COOKIE SANDWICH ON TOP?! COUNT ME IN! When our waiter presented me with my Cookies & Cream milkshake, I was so excited (and I wasn't even sugar high yet). This milkshake was delicious, except it was too sweet for my taste. If you love sweets, then this you will probably love this very much. This is a bit too much for one person to finish, but it's great for sharing. You can get all the boozy milkshakes without the alcohol for $3 less than the regular price for the boozy milkshakes, so that's what my friends and I did. 

*Frozen Grass Hopper (5\/5): My friend got this milkshake and I was so jealous after I tasted it because it was so good! To me it was so much better than the Cookies & Cream milkshake because it was a lot less sweeter. I also happen to be a mint ice cream enthusiast, so it was a 5 star milkshake for me. Definitely going to get this milkshake next time I come back and I definitely recommend this milkshake to any mint ice cream lovers!

I came walking out of the restaurant very full and satisfied. The fries and onion rings, were all very good, especially the burgers. The milkshakes were very unique and tasty as well. I can proudly say that Holsteins indeed makes the best burgers in Vegas, and maybe even makes the best in the state. I will definitely come back again for their delicious burgers and milkshakes!

Great place for Blended Shakes. My Banana mixed shake was pretty awesome.
Nice ambiance and kool place to chill !!
Heard great things about there burgers. Although I havent tried 
any of them, I only hear great things!!

I'm not sure what the hype is about. Having experienced the Gourmet Burger craze in both LA and Dallas maybe my expectations are just too high. Their "Gold Standard" burger has been touted as the best in Vegas... this has to be a joke. The mix of flavors were not balanced well. The goat cheese did not compliment the beef in any way. The ingredients were of good quality but not what I would expect for the price point. 

In general I would say everything on the menu was quite overpriced (even by Vegas standards). This is where Holsteins really fell short for me. I've had $10 burgers that blow this one away. Not to be super whiny but on top of the food not meeting my expectations  the service was a bit slow and my burger was slightly overcooked. Nothing egregious, but I would feel remiss to not point it out here. We tried the Lobster Mac & Cheese appetizer to start and I can't help but compare it to the Lobster Mac at The Capital Grille which is of better quality, a larger portion and actually cheaper than Holsteins. Even the steak fries were uninspired and blah. 

Overall I was disappointed at every turn by this place. The food was acceptable and I won't say it was a bad meal but it does not live up to the bar they have set for themselves. I would not go back. Save your money and go to one of the many other great restaurants in Las Vegas.

Ambience,  food, drinks,  service - 5stars!!!  Burgers are made to perfection! Best pork belly bun evah! They do it the way it should be done! The only thing that we didn't like was the tap water. . But there's beer!!! :)

Food: the rave reviews of the shakes are bit mislwading, as a person with a heavy sweet tooth I expected a better shake, though not awful they aren't good enough to recommend to others. Their burgers however are MOUTH WATERING TENDER and JUICY! Those patties are so savory you just want more!

Service: friendly and attentive couldn't have gotten better service.

Establishment: clean and theme oreintated. Very cool modern art with a vintage feel, they mashed the two themes together nicely.

This place is known to be the best burger in town... if this is the best burger in town then that's pretty sad, as the burger was very whatever. With that said, I would still give this place a 3.5 star review, because their claim is subjective anyways :)

Like I said before, the burger was mediocre. Pretty dry and not much taste. My boyfriend added a fried egg on his as well. Typically, when you order a fried egg, you would expect it to be over easy, right (especially so you can get that #eggporn picture duh)? This egg was over hard AF, so icky. I guess we should have specified so it's not their fault.

Anyways, besides the mediocre burger, the staff was very attentive and so sweet! Their fries and onion rings were really good, too. We even got 50% off a beer for checking in. Also, I would come back for the milkshakes. They were oversized and had alcohol in them (win win).

Recently had a late night dinner there on a weekday.  I probably would give this place a better review, but I'm still annoyed by how unbelievably loud the dining room was because it's across from the Marquee nightclub. My friends and I wanted to chat, but we couldn't without yelling at each other across our table. In the end, the loud music from Marquee gave us all headaches and destroyed our appetites.

We ordered the duck fat fries, the baked smashed potatoes, the asian pork belly buns and a regular hamburger. The duck fat fries were OK; in retrospect not worth the price ($7?) because I could barely taste any difference. The pork belly buns were also just OK; they could have used more pork belly, less buns, and a lot more sauce. They were pretty tasteless considering how thick the buns were. My friend's smashed potatoes were cheesy bacon-y goodness, so no qualms there.

One of my friends also ordered the s'mores drink, which she described as a dressed up mudslide. Is that worth $9-14? I don't think so.

My boyfriend and I were looking for a good burger place and read the
Reviews and we were really curious to try the bam-boozled drinks and the burgers looked delicious!  So we decided to try.  Our waiter was so nice and very helpful in our food and drink choices. We were very happy and impressed with our experience there! We had the red velvet cake shake and s'mores campfire shake. We loved them! Our burgers were amazing and so yummy! We will be definitely be coming back again!

One of the best Vegas restaurants I went to during my stay. I got a veggie burger, which was a fried coquette-like patty. Really delicious. They had complimentary spiced popcorn that I devoured. Our server was a really nice bro who made us feel welcome. Great comfortable booths too.

Huge beer selection. I had the Nom Nom burger and it rocked! Surprised that the prices were so reasonable. Service was excellent and it's a great place to eat and drink during a game. It's worth if my burger bucket list.

I went here for a weekday lunch, and had great service until the waitress seemed to disappear - it took literally 30 minutes from the end of the meal until we were able to leave the place because it took so long to receive the check.  The burgers and shakes were great, although there seemed to be some hidden add-ons and extras in terms of price.

This is one of my go to places to go when we are in town. We've been here 3-6 times in this past year alone and have not been disappointed yet. (I don't even live in Vegas!)

 

Appetizers:

Complimentary Popcorn served in a mini silver bucket (they have a bit of a kick).

Fried Pickles (dill pickles, & herb-caper mayo) never disappoint.

Poutine (French fries, cheese curds, shredded short rib, & stout gravy add fried egg) was ok.

Truffle Mac n' Cheese (creamy tallegio-mascarpone sauce, w\/ Maine lobster, & black truffle) was good and served in a mini iron dish.

 

Burgers:

The Rising Sun (kobe beef, teriyaki glaze, nori furikake, crispy yam, spicy mayo, & tempura avocado), Nom Nom (kobe beef, cheddar cheese, potato chips, 1000 island dressing) and the Gold Standard (dry aged beef sirloin burger w\/ smoked bacon, aged goat cheddar cheese, tomato confit, baby arugula, & garlic-chive aioli) are the best on the menu served Medium Rare. DO NOT FORGET TO TOP YOUR BURGER WITH AN EGG! They come with fries but you can get onion rings or sweet potato fries for an upcharge. I recommend the onion rings.

 

Shakes:

We tired the Coffee and Donuts (coffee ice cream, cake donut, malt, patron xo cafe, chocolate espresso beans) and the Campfire Smores (Smirnoff marshmallow vodka, chocolate, marshmallow, graham cracker crumble). They were both good.

 

Overall, this is a must stop place when we are here. The price of the burgers are not fast food prices but they don't taste like fast food burgers either. I see too many reviews complaining about the price and I wonder what in the world did they order. They must have forgot to get the egg or they just don't know what a good burger tastes like.

 

On weekends they have a DJ and makes it an even better experience. Can't wait to come back!
Awesome burgers and shakes! The lobster roll not soo much though

I had a tasty Bloody Mary, perfect degree of spice and flavor. 

Went with the classic burger and added grilled onions, mushrooms, and American cheese. Medium rare. Cooked perfectly and very good. 

My wife had the Rising Sun burger and "loved it!"

With the burger I tried the Holstein's special lager. Again, very good. 

All reasonably priced for Las Vegas!

I came here when I stayed in the Cosmopolitan last December. Holsteins was very conveniently located and fairly priced. We didn't have to wait long for a table, either. 

Food was good, service was good. I would definitely come back :) 

FYI - boyfriend and I both checked in via Foursquare and got a free alcoholic drink each.

This burger was freaking GINORMOUS and greasy as hell. Welcome to America! 

I got the fun-ghi burger. Great if you love mushrooms. The meat was like an inch thick (I'm totally exaggerating, but it was really big). I got it done medium, and it was perfect.  I told her to surprise me for the choice of fries, and she brought out the steak fries (try using the "surprise me" method more often-- typically, the servers will bring you what THEY think is best, so it never ends up bad). Fries were great (piping hot and crunchy on the outside), but the portions were so big, that I had to throw out a fair amount of the bun. There were a fair amount of options on the menu and they all sounded really good. 

Definitely worth coming to and would return!

Decent cocktails and they have milkshakes with booze - I'm in. The hamburgers are really good.

I only sat at the bar, which was nice.

My cousin has been extolling the virtues of Hollstein's for a while so I finally had a chance to try it. The adult milkshakes were very much intriguing. I had the banana foster, very creamy and they give you a lot so you can share with another person. It was a little too sweet and would be better for dessert but I preferred my beer with my burger. The burger was smaller than I had expected but that was fine since I filled up with the shake. I tried the fungi burger and it was very tasty! The mushrooms were on point. The beef was quality and juicy. I got their sweet potato fries and they were crispy and delicious too. My sis had the regular fries and they looked soggy and maybe the oil wasn't hot enough for them? 

Our server was super friendly and nice. Unfortunately, a lot of their draft beers which was too bad. The restaurant is clean, bright and I love the cow artwork! Definitely a more refined burger joint!

If you're looking for a good burger, at a decent price, Holsteins is the place to go.

With that said...if you're looking for an amazing burger at an OK price, go across the street to Gordon Ramsay Burger. 

After going with a group of friends and trying them both in the same night, everyone agreed Ramsay beat Holsteins (even their Kobe beef)...

Granted, we spent much less at Holsteins, and they had some crazy looking diabetes shakes, so if value is your thing, Holsteins does provide slightly better value.

So we decided to give this place a shot after hearing about all the hype! And it sure as hell stands up to it. 

Service was quite good and our waiter was very helpful with helping us choose the right dish that accommodates our palates (especially when considering the numerous number of different entrees and burgers here).

Their Kobe beef patties are on point and super juicy (get it medium rare to medium done). The "Rising Sun" is their most popular burger. Just think about a burger with ingredients that are similar to a sushi roll! The lobster mac 'n cheese is damn good too! Made with real lobster meat and truffles, this is the ultimate gourmet style junk food that will make your mouth water!

Grab yourself one of their x-rated milkshakes. When I say they are creepers, it ain't no lie! Don't let the sweetness fool you, they are infused with a good amount of goodness inside that you'll be surprised at how buzz you are within minutes!

Expect to wait anywhere between 20 mins to an hour!

P.S. - Check in on foursquare and you'll get a free beer on draft!

I really liked this place. Got a strawberry shake, and it reminded me of Red Robin's shakes which I love. Also, the burgers were delicious and surprisingly not too oily compared to other gourmet burgers. The one thing you have to try is the onion rings. I hate when onions are too large in onion rings, but Holsteins does it right with the thin onion strips and delicious breading.

My only complaint is the wait time. The first time we went, they told us it was a 30-40 minute wait for our food no matter what we ordered. Food NEVER takes that long to come out even in a steakhouse. We got lucky the second time we went because the waiter told us it was a 30-40 minute wait, noticed we were in a rush, and ended up pulling strings and got our food out in 10 minutes, so kudos to service!

I thought this place was pretty good. I might have had my expectations a little high hearing it was considered a top ten burger joint in america. I would defiantly have to disagree with that. Fried pickles and onion rings are really good.

The best restaurant in the whole wide world!! 
The Mac&cheese lobster is the best I've ever had in my entire life  !
And don't get me started about those amazing shakes...! 
Love love love this place !!

Delicious, great fun burger combinations. Extra rich and super sweet shakes and amply sized. Underwhelming sides.

Since it's Vegas, there's no point in stressing about the price, since everything is at least 50-100% marked up than what it should be.

The Rising Sun was truly an innovative combo: Kobe Beef, Teriyaki Glaze, Nori Furikake, Crispy Yam, Spicy Mayo, Tempura Avocado. Be warned, the Crispy Yam is merely just grated fried yams. The tempura avocado is extremely excellent though. But I mean, how do you go wrong with deep-fried fat? (For further reading: Fried Butter)

The Thai Steak Salad was barely average: Grilled Steak, Tomato, Cucumber, Red Onion, Romaine Lettuce, Green Papaya, Mint, Cilantro, Roasted Peanuts, tossed in a Sweet-chili Vinaigrette. The steak strips were substantial, but completely dry and tough, and I usually expect a sweeter sauce with my "Asian" salads, but the Sweet-chili vinaigrette was more vinaigrette than sweet or chili.

The regular fries & the sweet potato fries were mediocre at best, but the Onion rings were crisp, firm, and delicious.

USEFUL: EVERYTHING IS SUPER SALTY. EVERYTHING. Water will get you nowhere. My lips continually shriveled up from beginning to end no matter what I was eating. I was re-applying moisturizing lip balm like it was the air I breathe. I may try to ask for "Less salt" if I ever go back!

Overall the food tasted great: lots if flavor and variety. However, there aren't any vegetarian appetizers. So here's my advice, skip the appetizer and split one of their creatively delicious milk shakes. I got the tiramisu (virgin) and it was enough to split between two- they even put it in two glasses when we asked. You can substitute any burger with a vegan patty.  If you like spice, go with the machete burger. The vegan patty was flavorful and crunchy on the outside.

This place is pretty cool. 

The vodka-infused milkshakes are absolutely amazing. There are so many flavors to choose from and all of the blends I tried were really good. My favorite so far has been the s'mores flavor. YUM. 

I'm not much of a burger person, but there does seem to be a good selection of other meal options.
Excellent spot to go for a moderately priced meal.  The burgers are delicious and the shakes are off the charts.  The fries were good too.  My wife and I ate there twice on our last trip.

While on a business trip, I stopped over and had the Gold Standard and an IPA. The beer and the burger were great!  But the best thing Holsteins has going is their bartender Toshi!!  He gave me awesome suggestions from what id like to drink and eat as well as top secret spots in Vegas I'd enjoy!!

Pros:

Service is pretty stellar!  Very friendly & checks up on you frequently.  Crab sandwich roll was awesome.  Shakes are very tasty.

Cons:  Fries were not crispy & seemed like the were sitting out for a while.  Burgers were only average.

$70 for two people at lunch...  Worth it?  Not really.

We stopped in after our long jaunt from Yosemite through Death Valley. After a LONG drive we were ready for a refuel. This was exactly what we were looking for. Fantastic burgers and shakes. Perfect for us and the kids. All their shakes can me made for kids or adults with alcohol. I had the Greek burger which had fantastic flavor in the lamb,  highly recommend everyone to try. Also the onion rings where cook perfect, hate when you bite an onion ring and the whole onion comes out, not here, perfect! Lastly very conveniently located right in the Cosmopolitan where we stayed, great atmosphere with the crystal lounge right outside.
The service is pretty good but the calamari and their chips were not. The chips taste stale and their calamari was chewy and tasted fake. Wouldn't eat there again.

My husband and I stayed in Las Vegas for a week. We went the first night to this restaurant since it was close to our hotel room. We ended up comparing the 'billionaire burger' to every other restaurant we ate at. Nothing could compare! This billionaire burger with kobe beef, caramlized onions and truffle mayo is delicious!  We had to go back on our last night.

This is for TO GO. Bridgot at the bar has a stank unfriendly attitude. Dismissive and totally unfriendly. The guy working with her was very friendly. But she needs to get out of the service business if she can't be more friendly with customers. She practically threw my to go bag of food at me. 

The ahi tuna sliders are good though.

This would be a four-star joint . . . if it wasn't a burger joint. Why? Because it's a field crowded with gems. Browse my reviews: Bowery, Stout, Umami. I can't justify giving Holstein's a 4 when those places got 4s and 5s. That being said, there's a lot of good stuff at Holstein's and I'd proudly give it a 3.5 if that were possible. 

Let's start with their best: the boozy milkshakes (also available in non-boozy versions). I ordered the Fat Boy. It was awesome. Everything you want in a milkshake: candy, delicious vanilla milkshake PLUS booze! 

The service: pretty good. They were very attentive and helpful with the baby . . . even when he spilled all the milk they very nicely brought for him. They were great to the adults too. 

As for the food, as I said, the burgers were a 3.5. The fries were good, not great. I ordered the Gold Standard. I expected better. Not that it was bad, I was just expecting to be blown away and I wasn't. It is a hefty burger . . . split-able if you don't want to stuff yourself, especially if you get a milkshake. I can put it away . . . and I needed to ask for a box for some of it. 

So I apologize if my review seems lackluster. It's definitely good, but you can probably find a better burger within a block if you look.

Best burger of my life! Rising sun: love beef, teriyaki glaze, tempura avocado slice and spicy mayo. Served with crispy fried. I was so full after this meal, it was worth the $18 price tag. Outstanding service and fun vibe. 
Also had the vegan coconut raspberry milkshake, out of this world and huge portion!

Where do I possibly start....  It's pretty unbelievable to me that anyone gave this place a decent review for anything but the shakes, which to be honest... were fantastic.  Quite possibly some of the best shakes I ever had.  So why just one star?

Well...  When I go somewhere that specializes in burgers, I'd expect the burger to be great, at least good...  I would have even settled for mediocre...  Instead, it was easily the worst burger I have ever had...  I'd take McDonald's over this (I hate McDonald's), and for the price I could have had McDonald's 10 times over.  

So how bad was it?  Well...  Ever had a burger that was cooked on charcoal before all the butane finished burning off?  Well... this was worse.  This was kind of like directly eating that charcoal...  So maybe I just got unlucky with that ONE burger?  No such luck, because the waitress took it back, exchanged it for another, DIFFERENT burger, and it was almost as bad.  At this point, I am not sending it back again because I certainly don't want them to spit in it.

I really wanted to like this burger.  Hell, I wanted to LOVE it.  The descriptions and promised flavors were so enticing...  But all I could taste was burnt charcoal.

The waitress said that some people are extra sensitive to the charcoal flavor, but my friend had the same bad experience.  Besides... this is the first and only time I have ever experienced a burger like that. 

If I ever go back to Cosmo, I might have a shake there, but never another burger.  What a waste.

Lively burger spot with fun appetizers and boozy milkshakes.

Food: 4, atmosphere: 4, service: 2
Cost to worth it rating: 2.5 (my burger with additions was almost $20)
Return worthiness: yes

Highlights:
- Steakhouse burger: loved the pepper-crusted patty as it was no joke--you could see the full peppercorns. The onions were sweet and really good. I added an egg which was cooked perfectly so it ran to create it's own sauce from its yolk. Only con was the bun wasn't anything special or worth it.
- Bacon wrapped stuffed jalapeños: spicy! Liked the crispy bacon. There was cheese inside but not too much which my partially Asian stomach appreciated.
- Fried pickle spears: had the bumpy kind of breading which I liked
- Milkshakes: my friends loved these fun combos like smores or banana peanut butter cup (drunken monkey). See above comment for why I couldn't enjoy one, but I would've loved to. They do have fun vodka flavors on hand to make these like chocolate coconut which I do want to try.
- Fried bacon: never seen this outside of a county fair, but was pretty good in a smooth crispy batter
- Longhorn burger: the hub got this with BBQ brisket on the burger which seems crazy, but as a meat lover pizza type, he liked it
- Sweet potato fries: crispy and the right level of sweetness. I couldn't stop eating them.
- Decor: liked the fun art on the walls with toki doki-like characters

Midlights:
- Philly cheese steak egg roll: they looked like the Jack in the Box ones--which I love by the way--but with a tough exterior  that didn't work for me

Lowlights: 
- Service: our waiter had a fun personality but the service was nonexistent. 

Had a fun lunch here--I'd come back and hope for better service.

What an awesome burger place, the decorations and atmosphere was great. I ordered the tiramisu shake and complimentary Cajun popcorn. I also ordered the lobster Mac and cheese which is one of the best I've had! I ordered the Captain Hook as well, I plan to return the next time I'm in Vegas and get a burger!

I've heard about Holstein's via reviews on social media for about the past year, and finally tried the place with a friend last night.

The environment, food & service was good, but I do not understand what the buzz & rave reviews are about!

We arrived at about 9PM on a Wednesday & were promptly seated in the restaurant section (we could have sat in the bar or lounge area, but both were a little too noisy for us).    

I ordered a chocolate milkshake ($9) the "Urth" burger ($13) plus cheddar cheese ($2), mushrooms ($2) & grilled onions ($2) and for an extra $2 I could upgrade from fries to onion rings, so I did that as well.

My friend ordered the Executive burger, cooked medium, and a water.

Service was good -- not great, not bad, but OK\/good.

Ambiance -- casual attire by both guests as well as waitstaff, a little artsy architecture, numerous TVs on the walls.  Nothing pretentious, nor elegant.

Food -- My $9 chocolate shake didn't taste any different than a McDonalds chocolate shake, other than that it came with some whipped cream on the top (sorry, no cherry) & a little extra in a metal cup, old-school style.
My burger was great, but $19 great? Absolutely not.  I could have loaded-up at 5 Guys or In & Out burger and been just as happy with my burger, for a lot less $.   As for the onion rings, they were good, but not great, and on-par with a fresh order of onion rings you might get from Burger King!

My friend said his burger was good (not great...) despite it clearly being medium-rare, not the medium he ordered.

Total bill came to $50, + $10 tip = $60 for two, no alcohol & my friend just drinking water.

I realize Holstein's is in the Cosmopolitan & probably pays a lot of rent, but to the customer, that fact alone shouldn't justify the high prices -- better quality, better service, better interior design are needed there.

Am I glad I finally got around to trying Holstein's?  Sure!  Will I go back? Only if friends want to try it, but I'll try steering them elsewhere first.   We will certainly wander around the Cosmo and be awed by the high-class, sometimes ostentatious scenery, but if we're not on some sort of expense account, we'll go elsewhere for dinner.   Prices are the same or slightly higher at BurGR in Planet Hollywood but the service, atmosphere, & quality (such as the house-made buns & ketchup) are much better.

Came here for drinks and something to eat when we stayed at the cosmo. Im so glad that they have some decent places to eat, because now I can eat at the place and not stay there! Holsteins has great service, we were seated right away and ordered within 10 minutes. Great atmosphere, there was a dj playing hip hop and classic rock mixes.  Our food was brought out by the manager who was working the floor that night too. The lobster mac and cheese was amazing, and I saw some of the burgers on the next table, which looked too pretty to eat! Great beer list as well. Only con I could come up with were the douchey guys sitting at the bar trying to pick up on the waitresses. But hey, you'll find them everywhere in vegas.

Limited drinks menu if you don't feel like beer or milk shakes or soda ! Just a decaf coffee is all I wanted ! Waiting fir ahi sliders but the place is jumping for sure 
Presentation of sliders is lovely but tuna was cold and I think seared early this morning

After checking out so many places to eat for dinner we made it to Holsteins and I was excited about a made in house veggie burger and that the sides are included in the $17 burgers making it a bit cheaper than other gourmet burger options in Vegas.
The first hostess told us there would be a wait even though the didning area wasn't full but we could sit at the bar.
They had a tiny what they called "lounge" consisting of 4 tables and two chairs each so we took that.
I asked if we could order and have drinks until a table is free so we don't have to eat below our knees.
Nope not possible to move once you sat down...WTF???
Ok I was hungry so we ordered, the Longhorn with steak fries for the man, veggie burger and salad for me which was a $3 upgrade.
I hate when they do that, the few leaves of lettuce they give you don't cost more than the wedges my husband got, punishing you for trying to balance out your meal.
Our waitress the dumbest isch I've ever come across.
She was cooing over the single male patrons for a tip but dragged her ass bringing our stuff, got the drink order, the salad, my burger, everything wrong.
The food tasted  like crap, honestly.
I got my burger 15 minutes before my side salad and since I like it together I waited.
Wrong dressing, wait again.
By then burger cold, mushy, nasty and very wrong tasting.
Complain to manager that the waitress is a complete waste of space and the food horrible, my meal comped.
Barfed as soon as I made it back to my hotel room, thanks Holsteins!
Great food.. first time coming here and it was a great experience. . Our server Lucas was great.. he knew his menu very well and recommended the buffalo  chicken dip..

Ate at the bar on a weekday - attentive and funny bartenders. I was tempted to get a burger because they smelled soooo good while looking at the menu, but I hadn't no regrets because I fully loved the lobster sliders! Oh, and the shakes looked impressive too.. 

Kudos for the catchy urban art theme. :)

Amazing burger and some mind altering shakes..
good times, just have to figure out what to do after a 10k calorie intake

On a Saturday afternoon this place was packed with a lively crowd.  My hubby and I needed a little downtime before starting our night so we got a couple of milkshakes to go and enjoyed them up in our room.  Mine was the one with bananas and Frangelico in it.  So delicious!  You could taste the flavor of the liquor but it was not too strong.  The hubby got the Oreo one which I think had Bailey's in it.  His must have been stronger than mine since he totally passed out shortly after.  But that more likely was due to the fact that we had been at a kids birthday party all day.
Excellent food and great service. Brenda was an awesome waitress. I'll come back for sure.

If I reviewed based on food alone, wow!  Best tasting burger I have had in a while! No doubt. 

I made a reservation for 830, but I don't think we really needed it. I knew I wanted a burger in this Cosmopolitan Restaurant (double entendre), so I got the Nom Nom, but no 1000 Island. Mayo sucks. 

I got it cooked medium rare and it was so juicy! It was like butter, baby! 

Our waitress was alright, but my goodness the prices. That's what you get when you're in Vegas (KT PERRY WUZ RITE OMGZ).

The dessert menu looked awesome with all the shakes and malts, but I had already paid about 30 not including tip since I added a salad, mushrooms, and a fried egg to my burger. No doubt it was good, but I gotta hit the prices with a "Who ya crappin?". 

I'd go back, especially if I didn't have pay. Kobe (burger)!

Pleasantly surprised. I really liked this place... It was turning me on before the food just because its in the Cosmopolitan and the hot pink menus. 

The service was very friendly... creepy at times??? But they were awesome, prompt, and quick to everything. They kept us super satisfied. 

For the burgers, I got the Korean Bull Gogi... fun to say and fun to eat. It has a delicious, juicy patty, egg, kimchi, and a spicy mayo. DISCLAIMER.... NOT A FIRST DATE FOOD. Only for those who are in love and have no problem getting a little messy for your partner.... or if you're just going out with friends. Besides the mess... wow its a good burger. The egg is left a little runny (I spilled it all over the table:[). The kim chi and the spicy mayo blended perfectly together. I ate the whole thing without regret. 

My boy got the burger with brisket on it.. I forget what it was called, but we didn't talk much during our meal because we were busy stuffing our faces. I looked up once after finishing my half, and his was gone! 

We opted out on the shake, but we did get the "Candy Store" plate. It was pretty fun, but I prefer a bigger, more unified dessert. It had a mini dessert, and allowed your mouth to sample a variety of sweets. Pineapple\/coconut tapioca (mmm), custard donut with coffee\/chocolate syrup for dipping, mystery fruit jellies, chocolate custard push-pop, a mini chocolate dipped ice cream cone with banana ice cream, and the most exciting Nitrogen infused meringues. The waitress was sure to let us know you could blow smoke at your nose while eating them, 

The dessert was fun and different, but I'm not sure I would recommend it for the price. 

My experience at Holstein's leaves me with the impression of being able to return... but only on occasion as it is kinda pricey.

We came to Holstein's after walking out of the Noodle place, oops. We ordered:

Lobster Mac n Cheese: HOLYYYYYYY DELICIOUSNESS!!!!!! 
Onion Rings - Sauce is mild but with a spicy kick - Super good, big onion rings!
Chicago Dogs - Little pepper on top is spicy (I thought it was a green bean!) and totally bit into it and teared up a bit. Hot dog was good, not out of the this world.
Ahi Tuna Poke - AMAZING and fresh!! I wanted 3 orders of this!

Our server was great and friendly. I wouldn't mind coming back here for lunch again.

I really liked my food.  I ordered the "Urth" burger which is their house-made vegan patty.  I didn't want the sprouts and asked for the grilled onions.  My server said he'd have to charge me and couldn't substitute.  I understood since the menu said the onions were extra.  He said he wanted to make sure there were no surprises on the bill.

When he took my order, he asked if I wanted fries or a side salad.  I chose a side salad.  When I got the bill, the salad was an extra $2!  Two dollars for leaves?? I was disappointed in seeing that, especially since I had to eat in a hurry because we were going to see a show.  I have the menu in a different tab and I still don't see where it says that a salad is an extra cost.  I guess it was more of an investment for my health, but I would have still liked to have known since he said he didn't want me to be surprised.

Hands down, one of the top 3 burgers I have ever had in my life. And I'm a huge burger slut. I'm obsessed with burgers, so that says a lot!

I see this place all the time when I'm at The Cosmopolitan but never took it seriously because it looks a little cartoon-ey with the cartoon cow images hanging outside of the restaurant. But OMG I am a huge fan and cannot wait to come back! Here's why:

- Once you sit down, they give you a bucket of popcorn which is basically like crack. Freaking addicting. I don't know what kind of seasoning is on it, but we loved it so much that we bought 2 boxes of it to take with us!
- Boozy milkshakes. And they are amazingly obnoxious! We ordered a boozy milkshake that had candy corn stuck to the rim, a candy cane sticking out, and a SLICE OF PUMPKIN PIE on top! So insane and so good and so genius!
- French fries are crucial. They have regular and sweet potato, so we ordered both. They were perfectly crunchy and that's exactly how they should be. The portions were also very generous! And I think they make their own ketchup which means they take french fries seriously. They also have onion rings if you're not a french fry person.
- Saved the best for last. THE BILLIONAIRE BURGER. Here are the deets: Kobe beef, foie gras, port onion marmalade, frisee, & truffle mayo. I took a bite of my burger and thought "holy crap!" The burger was so rich and so full of flavor! The bun was fluffy which is always a plus. The beef was delicious and perfectly cooked. Foie gras was fatty and tasty. I ate this thing so fast and was so sad when it ended. If you love rich burgers, get this one!

Can't wait to come back here. If you love burgers, get one here. And a boozy milkshake. I promise you will not be disappointed!

We stopped in here for drinks. They have a fun and interesting drink menu. My boyfriend got the birthday cake shake with cake vodka. I'm lactose intolerant so I could only have a little sip. Wow, it was amazing. I got the red velvet. It's Guinness with chambord. It was so good! This was the perfect spot to take a break from shopping in the cosmopolitan.

Top notch!  On the Las Vegas strip is hard to find good food, let alone a great burger...there are way to many restaurants using glitz to bring people in.
We did our research...came to Holsteins.  Great atmosphere, slightly upscale casual restaurant with fun artwork.  Of course we got burgers.  They were amazing.  You could tell they use top notch beef and ingredients.  Sweet potatoes fries were great as well.  They were crispy but not crunchy.
Can't forget about the adult milk shakes!  We got the cookies and cream.  We might make a special trip to Vegas just for this burger in the future!

Finally, a Vegas burger restaurant that puts a smile on my face. 

There's a DJ in the restaurant, so if you are not here for the LOUD music - come here before 9 ~ 10 PM.

Good service and free complimentary popcorn - unfortunately, it tasted like a regular popcorn (I like kettle corn better than plain popcorn).

Truffle lobster mac n cheese (creamy Tallegio-mascarpone Sauce, with Maine lobster and black truffle - $16.5) - Wow, what an amazing appetizer. Not too creamy with a hint of lobster flavor. Definitely one of the top mac n cheese in my book.

The Rising Sun (Kobe beef, teriyaki glaze, nori furikake, crispy yam, spicy mayo & tempura avocado - $17, medium rare) - I love it! I really liked the tempura-fried avocado and the Kobe beef patty. The only downside? Teriyaki sauce was a bit too strong. 

Excellent burger and mac n cheese, enough said. 

P.S. - It's located at 2nd floor of the Cosmopolitan, right across from the Marquee Nightclub.

P.S.S. - This restaurant serves booze shakes.

4 STARS for food, convenience and quick service!
2 STARS for price and value.

Holstein's is a convenient after Marquee Pool Party stop, definitely shareable burgers or big enough to fill a single person up. The burgers were juicy, and they offer a diverse array of cocktails, beers, and milkshakes! I liked that you could grab a seat without waiting in any lines, and that the service was polite and quick.

* Hen House ($15) - 4.5 STARS: Beef With Fried Egg, Bacon, Lettuce, Tomato And Onion With Mustard & Ketchup. This was probably my favorite burger, even though it is so simple. Ordered medium rare, ofcourse.

* The Longhorn ($17) - 3.5 STARS: Beef Patty Topped With Texas Smoked Beef Brisket, Whiskey BBQ Sauce, Creamy Cole Slaw & Dill Pickle. I thought for sure this would take the cake, but there was alot going on. Sometimes simple is the best way to go.

* Truffle Lobster Mac n Cheese ($16.5) - 4 STARS: Creamy Tallegio-Mascarpone Sauce With Maine Lobster And Black Truffle. This was uber cheesy and truffly. Kind of expensive for the size but a nice small plate to share.
Sat at the bar all the staff was amazing the service was great food was great and quick for how busy they were def recommend

I really wanted to like this place. 

My date ordered the house lager, which tasted like malt liquor, not a microbrew.   

I ordered onion rings as an appetizer and they were brought out AFTER our burgers, not even with the burgers.  

The burgers were undercooked- I ordered mine well done and it came out medium well, while my date ordered medium well and his was medium rare.

The food was descent but excessively overpriced. You can get a comparable burger elsewhere for much cheaper, like stripburger.

It's so loud inside I could barely hear my date and he was sitting right across from me.  This place has a pretty annoying atmosphere.

Average setting, but outstanding fungi burger but it was on the small side for the hefty price point. The side salad was decent with limp greens and average house dressing. I was looking for a Vegas WOW and didn't get that for my $30.

California Turkey Burger over greens with fresh jalapenos, sprouts, cucumber, tomatoes, and a side of ranch! Great burgers with tons of flavor and nice shakes too!  Check this place out when you're in town.

I had a few dinners here and have yet to be disappointed. Imaginative, nouveaux-burger creations, a good selection of (pseudo-)artisanal beers, bam-boozled milk-shakes for adults - what's not to like?
I'll definitely be back for a casual (yet decent) dinner or two.

Fun place. Loud music. Waitresses dressed in cute outfits and knee-high socks. Bartenders were friendly, and the food was better than I'd expected. Then again, all of the restaurants at the Cosmopolitan are a grade above the others on the Strip. If you want to eat well, stay at the Cosmo. Another place I'd recommend is Jaleo, one floor up from Holsteins.

I got the Steakhouse burger, and it was everything in a good steak dinner piled up between two buns. Smokey, peppery, hearty, juicy burger. The shakes are very creamy too! Just pace yourself or you could end up with a 5,000-calorie lunch ;)

Very disappointed. Holstein Las Vegas customer service was once color blind except for green. Not to mention their chicken fingers with come back was ridiculous! 

Now there are no more chicken fingers and they see color. My wife are staying at the Cosmo and had our vacation ruined due to racism. We just finished up a great run at the Cosmo tables and wanted some of the Cosmo Holstein fingers to celebrate. Instead of a celebration we were greeted by a very rude young man with "you can't bring drinks in here." So we walked by the greeter--no word of this policy. We're staying in the hotel and have been transporting drinking throughout. And we're and Vegas transporting drinks with no issue because everyone can...I guess some can. My wife and I are appalled at the young man at Holsteins Vegas. He told us to finish our drinks before he would serve us. Then after questioning the bizarre statement, he said we needed to leave and finish then come back. As we walked out he greeted a a group of white girls with drinks and welcomed them with open arms. 

Holsteins you got a problem. It's huge and eating into your green.

This is a zero star post.

Good burgers. But just good. Not anything special. The price was too high for the burger. The shake was overly sweet. The fries were okay. The service was pushy. They really try to upsell you. Yeah I know, how do you upsell in a burger joint? Stop by and they will show you. Decor is fun though. I don't think I'll be coming back with all the other options on the strip.

The burgers here are fire! Went in on my last trip to Vegas when I was craving a burger and they did not disappoint. Service was great, and the five friends that I was with all agreed that the food was delicious and reasonably priced- which I is hard to do considering my diverse group of friends! Definitely going to be a stop on my next trip.

Short version: Cool\/fun decor, great service, and a couple of amazing burgers. Highly recommended.
